commit_message:
Pin mccabe to prevent it from breaking hacking

mccabe has undergone some very significant bug fixes recently but has
not yet released a new version. When it does, complexity calculations
will change in potentially significant ways.

Change-Id: I6e75391da19fde45588575517087d1ba4e4c44b7

commit_message:
Add pbr to installation requirements

Add pbr to the list of installation requirements so that it is installed
via pip before this library is installed, instead of with easy_install.
This avoids issues like Bug #1384919, and ensures that projects that use
this library as a dependency are properly installed.

Change-Id: I6c155370dbd01fe4748d5137bdf288e8d3e1a67e

subject: Clean up lockutils logging
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-24 22:02:07.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/concurrency/lockutils.py'], 'message': 'Clean up lockutils logging

As discussed in [1], the logging in lockutils is not ideal, both
in terms of clarity and volume.  This change removes some
redundant or just plain unnecessary log messages, while improving
the remaining ones to provide more detail to help debugging
contention issues.  Specifically, it:

 * Adds timing information to external lock messages, similar
   to what was already added for internal locks.
 * Removes a now-unnecessary 'attempting' message that was only
   useful for determining the timing info now included in the log
   message itself.
 * Removes a "released and closed" log message that isn't really
   interesting since it happens after the file was unlocked, and
   only tells us that the file was closed normally, when we would
   only care if that step failed for some reason (which will still
   be logged).
 * Removes the logging in internal_lock that was primarily added
   to debug a phantom problem with eventlet semaphores.
 * Adds a parameter to the lock() context that tells it whether
   to log its debug messages.  This allows synchronized to not
   log duplicate messages when it acquires a lock.

Changes for more intelligent logging, such as only logging when
contention occurs as opposed always, are left as a future
enhancement.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-September/047181.html

Partial-Bug: 1374075
Change-Id: I7bb36cdbb2e0f1643e1499054433894142cd2ee3
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up lockutils logging

As discussed in [1], the logging in lockutils is not ideal, both
in terms of clarity and volume.  This change removes some
redundant or just plain unnecessary log messages, while improving
the remaining ones to provide more detail to help debugging
contention issues.  Specifically, it:

 * Adds timing information to external lock messages, similar
   to what was already added for internal locks.
 * Removes a now-unnecessary 'attempting' message that was only
   useful for determining the timing info now included in the log
   message itself.
 * Removes a "released and closed" log message that isn't really
   interesting since it happens after the file was unlocked, and
   only tells us that the file was closed normally, when we would
   only care if that step failed for some reason (which will still
   be logged).
 * Removes the logging in internal_lock that was primarily added
   to debug a phantom problem with eventlet semaphores.
 * Adds a parameter to the lock() context that tells it whether
   to log its debug messages.  This allows synchronized to not
   log duplicate messages when it acquires a lock.

Changes for more intelligent logging, such as only logging when
contention occurs as opposed always, are left as a future
enhancement.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-September/047181.html

Partial-Bug: 1374075
Change-Id: I7bb36cdbb2e0f1643e1499054433894142cd2ee3

commit_message:
Add deprecated name test case

This is being separated from the change to deprecate the DEFAULT
grouped options because it is exposing a python 3 incompatibility
in oslotest and I don't want to block the release on something this
minor.  Once oslotest is fixed we can merge this to make sure
the deprecated options continue working.

Change-Id: Iabf5ad6ad1e7ad9a426783592f23f58452484b32

subject: Use six.wraps
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-25 00:07:23.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/concurrency/lockutils.py'], 'message': 'Use six.wraps

There is a slight difference in functools.wraps on python3.x and
on python2.x in regards to the __wrapped__ attribute that the six
version makes transparent; so instead of using the functools one
just use the six one to gain the added compatability.

Change-Id: Iccf2aede08504469c148ee5f81f448cadfc08d5e
'}]
commit_message:
Use six.wraps

There is a slight difference in functools.wraps on python3.x and
on python2.x in regards to the __wrapped__ attribute that the six
version makes transparent; so instead of using the functools one
just use the six one to gain the added compatability.

Change-Id: Iccf2aede08504469c148ee5f81f448cadfc08d5e

subject: Remove warning about management token
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-12 17:12:50.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/httpclient.py'], 'message': "Remove warning about management token

Because keystoneclient tries to figure out a management_url in all
contexts, it means that any end-user who uses any python-*client from
OpenStack that is using python-keystoneclient will always get a warning
about not being able to get a management token. This is, however, not
something that they need warning about, since there is no expectation
they'll have one. It's distressing to see it as part of normal
operation.

So just remove the warning.

Change-Id: Ia103a53c09c00fc09cef5fb24be546fc1da0684a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove warning about management token

Because keystoneclient tries to figure out a management_url in all
contexts, it means that any end-user who uses any python-*client from
OpenStack that is using python-keystoneclient will always get a warning
about not being able to get a management token. This is, however, not
something that they need warning about, since there is no expectation
they'll have one. It's distressing to see it as part of normal
operation.

So just remove the warning.

Change-Id: Ia103a53c09c00fc09cef5fb24be546fc1da0684a

commit_message:
Separate and refactor RAM filter unit tests

The Aggregate RAM filter unit tests were accessing the database to
create Aggregate records. This patch moves all the RAM filter unit tests
out of test_host_filters.py into their own test file and updates the
unit tests to remove any database accesses entirely.

Change-Id: I93399e2af0d230fac9a7f1eb308adfa15e0a84f8

Instead of using strings use module level constants for

revert/execution functions. This makes it easier for users

Change-Id: I739a0ad69819c3ca0d10c98966012cf9ef1b86bd
'}]
commit_message:
Use constants for retry automatically provided kwargs

Instead of using strings use module level constants for
the automatically provided keyword arguments to the retry
revert/execution functions. This makes it easier for users
of taskflow to associate these constants with the actual
keywords, without having to resort to using raw strings
directly.

Change-Id: I739a0ad69819c3ca0d10c98966012cf9ef1b86bd

commit_message:
Use constants for link metadata keys

Instead of using strings (which can be easy to
mistype and get wrong), provide a set of constants
that can be used to attach and use these keys in
flows and at compilation.

This also helps make it more clear what the keys
do and where they are used.

Change-Id: I5283b27617961136a4582bbcfce4617f05e8dd1d

subject: Fix race in shell when testing for errors to raise SysExit
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-20 08:00:10.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix race in shell when testing for errors to raise SysExit

SysExit is raised if the OutputManager has non-zero
error_count. However, error_count is incremented in
a print thread, but tested on the main thread.
Currently error_count is tested before the OutputManager
print threads have exited, which results in a race. This race
means that SysExit is not always raised even when an error
has occured.

This change moves the error_count test after the
OutputManager context manager has exited, which ensures that
the OutputManager threads have exited.

Change-Id: I5ef7d9f10057fe2b41f48ab95066a7265b86a3ac
Closes-Bug: #1379229
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race in shell when testing for errors to raise SysExit

SysExit is raised if the OutputManager has non-zero
error_count. However, error_count is incremented in
a print thread, but tested on the main thread.
Currently error_count is tested before the OutputManager
print threads have exited, which results in a race. This race
means that SysExit is not always raised even when an error
has occured.

This change moves the error_count test after the
OutputManager context manager has exited, which ensures that
the OutputManager threads have exited.

Change-Id: I5ef7d9f10057fe2b41f48ab95066a7265b86a3ac
Closes-Bug: #1379229

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-21 06:24:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/scheduler/test_host_filters.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/filters/test_affinity_filters.py'], 'message': 'Separate and refactor affinity filter tests

The unit tests for the scheduler affinity tests were actually *not*
NoDBTestCase tests. In fact, they were relying on the database to create
instance objects instead of just mocking out the call to
nova.compute.api.get_all(). This patch corrects that and separates out
the affinity filter unit tests out of test_host_filters.py.

Change-Id: Ib7268a49e115fbeff7f18c569cecd82b3d3e8cb3
'}]
commit_message:
Separate and refactor affinity filter tests

The unit tests for the scheduler affinity tests were actually *not*
NoDBTestCase tests. In fact, they were relying on the database to create
instance objects instead of just mocking out the call to
nova.compute.api.get_all(). This patch corrects that and separates out
the affinity filter unit tests out of test_host_filters.py.

Change-Id: Ib7268a49e115fbeff7f18c569cecd82b3d3e8cb3

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-21 19:05:27.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_db.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Can not delete images if db deadlock occurs

Glance api returns 500 Internal Server Error, if db deadlock occurs
in glance-registry for some reason while deleting an image.

Added retry on image_destroy when db deadlock occures which will again
try to delete the image from database.

Closes-bug: 1378215
Change-Id: Ifad403e363daf368e846b5b6838432a7bedbe81a
(cherry picked from commit dae0fa8f1071be41d5541e9a5254abea48f5ba36)
'}]
commit_message:
Can not delete images if db deadlock occurs

Glance api returns 500 Internal Server Error, if db deadlock occurs
in glance-registry for some reason while deleting an image.

Added retry on image_destroy when db deadlock occures which will again
try to delete the image from database.

Closes-bug: 1378215
Change-Id: Ifad403e363daf368e846b5b6838432a7bedbe81a
(cherry picked from commit dae0fa8f1071be41d5541e9a5254abea48f5ba36)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-17 14:14:23.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Put a cap on our cyclomatic complexity

flake8 has support for cyclomatic complexity (Mccabe) currently our
worst offender has a complexity of 15 (25 is considered very bad). So
set our max-complexity to 16 so we at least don't make things any worse.

https://github.com/flintwork/mccabe

Change-Id: Ied156f42aaee351f0023ea7dc38bb307ccdbf098
"}]
commit_message:
Put a cap on our cyclomatic complexity

flake8 has support for cyclomatic complexity (Mccabe) currently our
worst offender has a complexity of 15 (25 is considered very bad). So
set our max-complexity to 16 so we at least don't make things any worse.

https://github.com/flintwork/mccabe

Change-Id: Ied156f42aaee351f0023ea7dc38bb307ccdbf098

commit_message:
Move the panel mocks to a separate method on TestCase

We need to remove the panel mocks in Tuskar-UI tests, because they
import and register the admin panel as their side effect. To do that
easily, I'm moving that part into a separate method.

Partial-bug: #1384683
Change-Id: Ica366c0b9f680049a74e94007a563ffdb492e4f4

Some l3-related functions call _update_router_gw_info within
db transaction.

_update_router_gw_info calls create_port() and delete_port()
from core plugin, and the two port-related operations will call
notification which will lead to eventlet yield.

If yield switches a thread to another one that tries to access
the same router object in db we're locked and get db timeout.

The workaround is to make _update_router_gw_info outside of
db transaction.

Related plugins are also updated to reflect the logic.

This bug fix will revert the previous commit:
Pass newly created router to _update_router_gw_info
Change-Id: I7fbbd675839c2874578c62dfed390d86e3b4801a
Commit-Id:06760aff355a4795cec9a17fa330c191cabcfe62

Because _update_router_gw_info is removed out of the transaction,
If we still want to keep the router_db and pass it to
_update_router_gw_info, we need to first merge it.
Here, I prefer retrieve it again from db, rather than merge it.

Change-Id: If24603eac11ea8bd15871a4a0ad9d2bddf829af4
Closes-Bug: #1334109
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid db lock caused by notification inside db transaction

Some l3-related functions call _update_router_gw_info within
db transaction.

_update_router_gw_info calls create_port() and delete_port()
from core plugin, and the two port-related operations will call
notification which will lead to eventlet yield.

If yield switches a thread to another one that tries to access
the same router object in db we're locked and get db timeout.

The workaround is to make _update_router_gw_info outside of
db transaction.

Related plugins are also updated to reflect the logic.

This bug fix will revert the previous commit:
Pass newly created router to _update_router_gw_info
Change-Id: I7fbbd675839c2874578c62dfed390d86e3b4801a
Commit-Id:06760aff355a4795cec9a17fa330c191cabcfe62

Because _update_router_gw_info is removed out of the transaction,
If we still want to keep the router_db and pass it to
_update_router_gw_info, we need to first merge it.
Here, I prefer retrieve it again from db, rather than merge it.

Change-Id: If24603eac11ea8bd15871a4a0ad9d2bddf829af4
Closes-Bug: #1334109

commit_message:
Fix the example 'default_provides'

The example should be declaring that the whole result is 'a'
and not just the first element of the returned result (which
in this case is the string index[0] which is also 'a') to
avoid propagating bad/broken patterns in the examples.

Fixes bug 1383422

Change-Id: I3a39bb25291276d29ee260e84aab9ec182499fd9

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError when test_function_help fails

This commit fixes a missed usage of the CommandFailed exception during
the migration moving it from tempest.cli to tempest.exceptions in change
Ibf5f1cbbb847d32976b54c4484acfc3c0e3b4f48. The outdated module
path could cause an AttributeError to be raised because the exception no
longer existing in tempest.cli.

Change-Id: I502eaef3486d903931dab43069cec1ae7ee570f1

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-24 13:31:45.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add pbr to installation requirements

Add pbr to the list of installation requirements so that it is installed
via pip before this library is installed, instead of with easy_install.
This avoids issues like Bug #1384919, and ensures that projects that use

Change-Id: I6c155370dbd01fe4748d5137bdf288e8d3e1a67e
'}]
commit_message:
Add pbr to installation requirements

Add pbr to the list of installation requirements so that it is installed
via pip before this library is installed, instead of with easy_install.
This avoids issues like Bug #1384919, and ensures that projects that use
this library as a dependency are properly installed.

Change-Id: I6c155370dbd01fe4748d5137bdf288e8d3e1a67e

commit_message:
Porting baremetal_nodes extension to v2.1/v3

This patch ports baremetal-nodes(include baremetal-stat-ext)
to v2.1 and make v2 and v2.1 share unit test cases.

In v2.1/v3,baremetal-nodes will not depend on baremetal-stat-ext.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api
Change-Id: I0f6a968897975ee91e76538d2ce7d2538044613e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-23 03:56:11.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/types.py', 'heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_types.py'], 'message': "Tolerate null on Json db load

A icehouse->juno migration issue has surfaced where
resource.properties_data is null for existing resource records.

This change fixes the Json db type to treat None the same as

Change-Id: Ia0b9a23a7798c95fbbcba439ffb8203b50367e7c
Closes-Bug: #1383505
"}]
commit_message:
Tolerate null on Json db load

A icehouse->juno migration issue has surfaced where
resource.properties_data is null for existing resource records.

This change fixes the Json db type to treat None the same as
the serialized JSON 'null'.

Change-Id: Ia0b9a23a7798c95fbbcba439ffb8203b50367e7c
Closes-Bug: #1383505

commit_message:
Improve lock_path help and documentation

Improve help string to state default value and that it's mandatory.
Document set_defaults function.

DocImpact: Document that the value needs to evaluate to a valid path.
So, either environment variable is set or option is set.

Change-Id: I481d2f8107476ba166a18bc56d3b4c1be5ff726f

subject: Fix server create for boot-from-volume
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-24 22:57:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': "Fix server create for boot-from-volume

* server create required --image even when booting the server from a
  volume.  Change options to require either --image or --volume to
  specify the server boot disk.  Using --volume currently uses device
  'vda' for the block mapping and ignores any other block mappings
  given in --block-device-mapping.
* server create and server show are both affected by bug 1378842 where
  an excepion was thrown when no image ID was present in the returned
  server object, which is the case for a server booted from a volume.
* Fix the remaining assertEqual() order problems in test_server.py

Closes-Bug: 1378842
Closes-Bug: 1383338
Change-Id: I5daebf4e50a765d4920088dfead95b6295af6a4d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix server create for boot-from-volume

* server create required --image even when booting the server from a
  volume.  Change options to require either --image or --volume to
  specify the server boot disk.  Using --volume currently uses device
  'vda' for the block mapping and ignores any other block mappings
  given in --block-device-mapping.
* server create and server show are both affected by bug 1378842 where
  an excepion was thrown when no image ID was present in the returned
  server object, which is the case for a server booted from a volume.
* Fix the remaining assertEqual() order problems in test_server.py

Closes-Bug: 1378842
Closes-Bug: 1383338
Change-Id: I5daebf4e50a765d4920088dfead95b6295af6a4d

commit_message:
Remove useless join in nova.virt.vmwareapi.vm_util

This change replaces in nova.virt.vmwareapi.vm_util the pattern
''.join(['fo...o'], ['b...ar']) by the pattern 'fo...ob...ar' which
avoids runtime string concatenation.

Change-Id: If23d8377acde2c3419b67ca11b03a1c898561c77

subject: Merge fileutils from oslo-incubator
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-24 21:48:09.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/concurrency/openstack/common/log.py', 'oslo/concurrency/openstack/common/fileutils.py'], 'message': 'Merge fileutils from oslo-incubator

We need to get rid of our copy of log.py in oslo.concurrency.

oslo.concurrency code needs fileutils from oslo-incubator.
fileutils needs the common copy of log.py. What happens when we
import oslo.concurrency into nova, we end up with duplicate
options for default_log_levels. So to unravel the knots,
we switch fileutils over to python logging and hence remove
the need for common copy of log.py in oslo.concurrency.

Fixed the import for excutils as well since that change
has already been made in the oslo-incubator copy of fileutils

Closes-Bug: #1385492
Change-Id: I5310bf8a6584ac4f71b607d30b9dae0b12441d41
'}]
commit_message:
Merge fileutils from oslo-incubator

We need to get rid of our copy of log.py in oslo.concurrency.

oslo.concurrency code needs fileutils from oslo-incubator.
fileutils needs the common copy of log.py. What happens when we
import oslo.concurrency into nova, we end up with duplicate
options for default_log_levels. So to unravel the knots,
we switch fileutils over to python logging and hence remove
the need for common copy of log.py in oslo.concurrency.

Fixed the import for excutils as well since that change
has already been made in the oslo-incubator copy of fileutils

Closes-Bug: #1385492
Change-Id: I5310bf8a6584ac4f71b607d30b9dae0b12441d41

commit_message:
Update novaclient shell to use shared arguments from Session

The novaclient implemented it's own version of the CLI arguments that
are now provided by keystoneclient's session object. This changeset
converts nova over to utilizing the shared argument registration.

commit_message:
Add support to restrict images to certain flavors

Allows support for checking 'flavor_groups' property on images for
flavor group permissions.

Example permissions:

    '!*,ironic' or just 'ironic' -- Only allow image to be used for
                                    'ironic' flavor groups
    '*,!ironic'                  -- Allow image to be used for all
                                    flavors except 'ironic' flavor
                                    groups.

Default for images with no property is '!*'.

Implements: blueprint restrict-image-types

Change-Id: I06373c8bfc572c5448b7f1ef210a3b671c8ab6d8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9216, 'name': 'Joel Wright', 'email': 'joel.wright@gmail.com', 'username': 'jjw-sohonet'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-10-20 08:00:10.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'swiftclient/service.py'], 'message': 'Fix race between container create jobs during upload

During a segmented object upload, attempts are made
to create the container for the manifest and the
segment container. These jobs are currently placed
on separate threads and can occur out of order which
causes the unit test failure seen in the bug report.

The container jobs should be ordered because the
segment container job attempts to HEAD the manifest
container to determine correct storage policy.

This patch enforces ordering of the two jobs and
modifies the unit test to assert that both container
PUTs occur in the expected order.

Change-Id: If90bec126867a4be2df34067ccefee660202f59f
Closes-Bug: #1376878
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race between container create jobs during upload

During a segmented object upload, attempts are made
to create the container for the manifest and the
segment container. These jobs are currently placed
on separate threads and can occur out of order which
causes the unit test failure seen in the bug report.

The container jobs should be ordered because the
segment container job attempts to HEAD the manifest
container to determine correct storage policy.

This patch enforces ordering of the two jobs and
modifies the unit test to assert that both container
PUTs occur in the expected order.

Change-Id: If90bec126867a4be2df34067ccefee660202f59f
Closes-Bug: #1376878

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-23 07:22:47.000000000', 'files': ['etc/glance-api.conf', 'etc/glance-cache.conf'], 'message': 'remove url-path from the default value of s3_store_host

For s3 endpoints, url-path is not necessary to define and it's
something like just "s3.amazonaws.com" for Amazon s3 or
"s3.compatibleserver.com:8080" for S3 thirdparty compatible server
that is listening on 8080. So the current default value with '/v1.0/'
of s3_store_host is confusing.

s3_store_host = 127.0.0.1:8080/v1.0/

DocImpact: The following parameter is changed in glance-api.conf
and glance-cache.conf.
-s3_store_host = 127.0.0.1:8080/v1.0/
+s3_store_host = 127.0.0.1:8080

Change-Id: I3b103121e46f58fda339530c62c71b65a69e5dc5
'}]
commit_message:
remove url-path from the default value of s3_store_host

For s3 endpoints, url-path is not necessary to define and it's
something like just "s3.amazonaws.com" for Amazon s3 or
"s3.compatibleserver.com:8080" for S3 thirdparty compatible server
that is listening on 8080. So the current default value with '/v1.0/'
of s3_store_host is confusing.

s3_store_host = 127.0.0.1:8080/v1.0/

DocImpact: The following parameter is changed in glance-api.conf
and glance-cache.conf.
-s3_store_host = 127.0.0.1:8080/v1.0/
+s3_store_host = 127.0.0.1:8080

Change-Id: I3b103121e46f58fda339530c62c71b65a69e5dc5

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-23 01:26:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/wsgi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': "Cinder api service doesn't handle SIGHUP properly

When SIGHUP signal is sent to cinder-api service, it doesn't complete
processing of all pending requests before terminating all the
processes.

This change is a copy of Abhishek Kekane's fix for nova api.

Change-Id: I049d2aa2f3ad1fe388e00213a71f374803ed409a

"}]
commit_message:
Cinder api service doesn't handle SIGHUP properly

When SIGHUP signal is sent to cinder-api service, it doesn't complete
processing of all pending requests before terminating all the
processes.

This change is a copy of Abhishek Kekane's fix for nova api.

Change-Id: I049d2aa2f3ad1fe388e00213a71f374803ed409a
Closes-Bug: #1334647
(cherry picked from commit 6c3ad4cf55c5f4cb610fb2625aed1286857b6c67)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-24 15:52:52.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add the Neutron DVR job to the tempest experimental queue

The DVR job is not in the check pipeline for Tempest changes.
This is acceptable for now, as the job is still non voting for
Neutron; however, issues like #1381617 may have been prevented
with some reviewer attention and some CI's aid.

Adding the job to the experimental queue can help with the latter
especially to vet [1] more effectively.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130655/

Change-Id: I9e5148abff804218fa3e16aa7d70b17a6658d78a
"}]
commit_message:
Add the Neutron DVR job to the tempest experimental queue

The DVR job is not in the check pipeline for Tempest changes.
This is acceptable for now, as the job is still non voting for
Neutron; however, issues like #1381617 may have been prevented
with some reviewer attention and some CI's aid.

Adding the job to the experimental queue can help with the latter
especially to vet [1] more effectively.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130655/

Change-Id: I9e5148abff804218fa3e16aa7d70b17a6658d78a

subject: Switch fileutils to use python logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-24 21:36:43.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/fileutils.py'], 'message': 'Switch fileutils to use python logging

oslo.concurrency code needs fileutils from oslo-incubator.
fileutils needs the common copy of log.py. What happens when we
import oslo.concurrency into nova, we end up with duplicate
options for default_log_levels. So to unravel the knots,
we switch fileutils over to python logging and hence remove
the need for common copy of log.py in oslo.concurrency.

Change-Id: Ida7ff3418db7c2a0a5e8b827e1c277533812b8ed
'}]
commit_message:
Switch fileutils to use python logging

oslo.concurrency code needs fileutils from oslo-incubator.
fileutils needs the common copy of log.py. What happens when we
import oslo.concurrency into nova, we end up with duplicate
options for default_log_levels. So to unravel the knots,
we switch fileutils over to python logging and hence remove
the need for common copy of log.py in oslo.concurrency.

Change-Id: Ida7ff3418db7c2a0a5e8b827e1c277533812b8ed

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-24 08:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/openstack/common/service.py'], 'message': "Traverse children list to check if any worker stop

Neutron server spawns two green threads for api and rpc job. In
_wait_child, both green threads get pid of the stopped worker from
os.waitpid, but if the pid is not in the green thread's children
list, the stopped worker is not restarted.

Considering this two green threads are in the same process, api
green thread may get a pid belonging to a worker forked by rpc
green thread and will not restart the worker. We need to traverse
the children list of each green thread in _wait_child to ensure
stopped worker can be properly recognized.

Change-Id: I92609fc9d65fe77065b33cf2c8bb36345b7247ac
Closes-Bug: #1384580
"}]
commit_message:
Traverse children list to check if any worker stop

Neutron server spawns two green threads for api and rpc job. In
_wait_child, both green threads get pid of the stopped worker from
os.waitpid, but if the pid is not in the green thread's children
list, the stopped worker is not restarted.

Considering this two green threads are in the same process, api
green thread may get a pid belonging to a worker forked by rpc
green thread and will not restart the worker. We need to traverse
the children list of each green thread in _wait_child to ensure
stopped worker can be properly recognized.

Change-Id: I92609fc9d65fe77065b33cf2c8bb36345b7247ac
Closes-Bug: #1384580

commit_message:
Use graduated oslo libraries

The following libraries have been graduated:
- gettextutils -> oslo.i18n
- jsonutils -> oslo.serialization
- strutils, timeutils -> oslo.utils

Add neutronclient.i18n module as oslo.i18n adapter.

Remove openstack.common related files completely
because neutronclient no longer use any oslo-incubator modules.

Closes-Bug: #1382017
Change-Id: Ib7ebcb691a12858049baab3b122f95bf43038f18

Previously, there was a version of mask_password provided by
keystone/openstack/common/log.py. The mask_password function has since
graduated to oslo.utils.strutils and should be used instead. The
mask_password function provided in oslo.utils will handled unicode

Closes-Bug: #1384409

commit_message:
Use mask_password from oslo.utils.strutils

Previously, there was a version of mask_password provided by
keystone/openstack/common/log.py. The mask_password function has since
graduated to oslo.utils.strutils and should be used instead. The
mask_password function provided in oslo.utils will handled unicode
issues where as the one provided in oslo-incubator will not.

Change-Id: Icead6e59a624e34c47aafbbe9bdd94eca49d3893
Closes-Bug: #1384409

When running inside a Docker container, we cannot rely on devices in
/dev/mapper to be automagically created by udev, because we probably
don't have a udev at all.  To work around this, run dmsetup mknodes
after every kpartx run.

Change-Id: If7e30579224ce54c5ed26d08974d8293c144719a
"}]
commit_message:
Make diskimage-builder work in Docker.

When running inside a Docker container, we cannot rely on devices in
/dev/mapper to be automagically created by udev, because we probably
don't have a udev at all.  To work around this, run dmsetup mknodes
after every kpartx run.

Change-Id: If7e30579224ce54c5ed26d08974d8293c144719a

subject: Add feature to update/replace yum configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-02 15:52:35.000000000', 'files': ['elements/yum-repos/README.md', 'elements/yum-repos/extra-data.d/99-override-default-yum-repos'], 'message': 'Add feature to update/replace yum configuration

This change is required in order to build images with
yum-based distros with custom/updated packages, 
same functional is available for apt-based distros with elements/apt-sources

DIB_YUM_CONF should be used to override yum.conf, e.g:
    DIB_YUM_CONF=/etc/yum.conf

To override yum repos completely use DIB_REPLACE_YUM_REPOS, e.g.:
    DIB_REPLACE_YUM_REPOS=/etc/repos.d/

To add additional yum repos to existing one:
    DIB_ADD_YUM_REPOS=/etc/repos.d/

Change-Id: Ibe38dfa4564c91fb6452618bc6f52e3cc209f21c
'}]
commit_message:
Add feature to update/replace yum configuration

This change is required in order to build images with
yum-based distros with custom/updated packages, 
same functional is available for apt-based distros with elements/apt-sources

DIB_YUM_CONF should be used to override yum.conf, e.g:
    DIB_YUM_CONF=/etc/yum.conf

To override yum repos completely use DIB_REPLACE_YUM_REPOS, e.g.:
    DIB_REPLACE_YUM_REPOS=/etc/repos.d/

To add additional yum repos to existing one:
    DIB_ADD_YUM_REPOS=/etc/repos.d/

Change-Id: Ibe38dfa4564c91fb6452618bc6f52e3cc209f21c

commit_message:
Cinder api service doesn't handle SIGHUP properly

When SIGHUP signal is sent to cinder-api service, it doesn't complete
processing of all pending requests before terminating all the
processes.

This change is a copy of Abhishek Kekane's fix for nova api.

Change-Id: I049d2aa2f3ad1fe388e00213a71f374803ed409a
Closes-Bug: #1334647

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-24 09:57:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/volume/encryptors/luks.py'], 'message': "Retry on closing of luks encrypted volume in case device is busy

We're seeing races in the gate on detach of an encrypted volume where
the device is busy so the detach fails, which causes the delete of the
volume on the cinder side to fail because the volume is still in use and
then Tempest times out waiting for the volume to be deleted.

This simply adds a retry to close the encryption device.  I use
attempts=3 since that's what we use for lvremove.

Closes-Bug: #1374458

Change-Id: Ia0667da7dee247ba8c3338b296244b2a71d1045d
(cherry picked from commit eef97cdf4bb7f426d7feb394ef54510db8b1656b)
"}]
commit_message:
Retry on closing of luks encrypted volume in case device is busy

We're seeing races in the gate on detach of an encrypted volume where
the device is busy so the detach fails, which causes the delete of the
volume on the cinder side to fail because the volume is still in use and
then Tempest times out waiting for the volume to be deleted.

This simply adds a retry to close the encryption device.  I use
attempts=3 since that's what we use for lvremove.

Closes-Bug: #1374458

Change-Id: Ia0667da7dee247ba8c3338b296244b2a71d1045d
(cherry picked from commit eef97cdf4bb7f426d7feb394ef54510db8b1656b)

commit_message:
Fix dynamic select layout when help block is displayed

This fixes the layout of the dynamic select widget when the help
block is displayed. To reproduce this error you must be using the
keystone v2 API so that the Primary Project field will be required
when creating a user. If you leave it blank when submitting the
form the help block will be displayed.

Closes-Bug: #1361725
Change-Id: Ied4bb5d22b7e8a1948330503516cba2aa016417f

commit_message:
Ensure DataTableView applies filter after redirect

Non-API bound filters were not persisting across pages changes,
this patch adds an additional check to make sure the DataTable looks
for any non api bound filters in the session and applies them on page load.
Also added some logic to make Project filter in Admin->Instances API
bound using the tenant_id.

Change-Id: Ieab9f2b92b59401809725a4f37628757dc4c8f13
Closes-Bug: 1369014

commit_message:
SELinux: Update keepalived custom policy

Found additional denials with keepalived unable able to read /proc.
Updated the custom policy to allow keepalived to read /proc.

These additional changes are temporary and should be removed
when the denials are fixed in the upstream selinux-policy.

Partial-Bug: 1379079
Change-Id: I30d74f80386e908822fcc6ff5ac3d4ae90fc4e27

commit_message:
Add pbr to dependency list

We use pbr to install stevedore, and because of the way setuptools deals
with install-time requirements we also need to include it as a runtime
dependency to ensure it is installed by pip and not easy_install.

Change-Id: I0a39bb50218a1a7cdb2d42fb474a9b8f6d6ac32a
Closes-Bug: #1384919

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.config

The config module in oslo-incubator has been replaced by oslo.config.
Projects need to switch completely to oslo.config for kilo.

This patch does:
* Register options with oslo.config (new file manila/opts.py)
* Generate the config file using oslo-config-generator
* Remove obsoleted entries for this from openstack-common.conf
* Remove oslo-incubator config files

Change-Id: I30b594423c08782e13a1f615099ae65f997a8551
Closes-Bug: #1382183

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-01 12:44:11.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_rbd_store.py', 'glance/store/rbd.py'], 'message': "Make rbd store's pool handling more universal

Currently we ignore the pool part of the location throughout the rbd store code.
If there is a pool specified, use that. Otherwise we can still fall back to the
configured pool.

This is a required change if we want to support ephemeral disk snapshotting later on
as in that scenario the ephemeral pool might be a different pool from images pool,
yet we're going to need to reference the snapshot of a disk in the ephemeral pool.

Change-Id: Ie415667a809975948c8cfb71ec63a0905995fa67
Closes-Bug: 1368128
"}]
commit_message:
Make rbd store's pool handling more universal

Currently we ignore the pool part of the location throughout the rbd store code.
If there is a pool specified, use that. Otherwise we can still fall back to the
configured pool.

This is a required change if we want to support ephemeral disk snapshotting later on
as in that scenario the ephemeral pool might be a different pool from images pool,
yet we're going to need to reference the snapshot of a disk in the ephemeral pool.

Change-Id: Ie415667a809975948c8cfb71ec63a0905995fa67
Closes-Bug: 1368128

commit_message:
Fixes nothing is displayed if volume metadata is empty problem

If volume metadata is empty, nothing is displayed below "Metadata"
<h4> heading in the volume detail page. So, this patch fixes this
problem by displaying "None".

Change-Id: I0302e47cc8c9e471972ef7c249d54582242b5390
Closes-bug: #1382876

commit_message:
Fix dict iteration usage

When iterating a dict, it is redundant to create a list of keys
using the keys() method. Using iteritems() lets us iterate a dict more
efficiently.

Closes-Bug: #1384990

Change-Id: If8ffcf19129430506020adb9716a7dfdda9d98f5

commit_message:
Fix tempest compatibility

Decorator "safe_setup" was removed in Tempest project, we need to remove its
usage to fix compatibility.

Gerrit commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122531/
Tempest commit: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/c27feb85

Change-Id: I1c9a9a668b3d7761c07af72aff8415b86ffaa8a5
Closes-Bug: #1378677

The files opened for the --files and --user-data options were never
closed, potentially leaking memory in a long-running client. Close

commit_message:
Close files on server create, add tests

The files opened for the --files and --user-data options were never
closed, potentially leaking memory in a long-running client. Close
them if they are file objects.

Add a couple of basic tests for server create.

Change-Id: I1658b0caa2d6af17308149cb52196ee28266ddf2

commit_message:
Freeze mccabe's version for hacking

mccabe has some drastic changes on master that will not introduce
backwards incompatible behaviour but will make the tool more accurately
compute complexity for various situations. To prevent surprises Joe
Gordon and I have decided to freeze the version now.

Change-Id: I768b785cb61172eb857a7710064e262f007dd138

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-23 20:38:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'openstackclient/api/auth.py', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_clientmanager.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': "Change --os-auth-plugin to --os-auth-type

User's don't know what a plugin is.

* Internally, os_auth_type and/or auth_type represents what the
  user supplied.
* auth_plugin_name is the name of the selected plugin
* auth_plugin is the actual plugin object

Plugin selection process:
* if --os-auth-type is supplied:
  * if it matches against an available plugin, done
  * (if it can map to an availble plugin type, done; TODO in a followup)
* if --os-auth-type is not supplied:
  * if --os-url and --os-token are supplied, select 'token_endpoint'
  * if --os-username supplied, select identity_api_version + 'password'
  * if --os-token supplied, select identity_api_version + 'token'

Change-Id: Ice4535214e311ebf924087cf77f6d84d76f5f3ee
"}]
commit_message:
Change --os-auth-plugin to --os-auth-type

User's don't know what a plugin is.

* Internally, os_auth_type and/or auth_type represents what the
  user supplied.
* auth_plugin_name is the name of the selected plugin
* auth_plugin is the actual plugin object

Plugin selection process:
* if --os-auth-type is supplied:
  * if it matches against an available plugin, done
  * (if it can map to an availble plugin type, done; TODO in a followup)
* if --os-auth-type is not supplied:
  * if --os-url and --os-token are supplied, select 'token_endpoint'
  * if --os-username supplied, select identity_api_version + 'password'
  * if --os-token supplied, select identity_api_version + 'token'

Change-Id: Ice4535214e311ebf924087cf77f6d84d76f5f3ee

subject: Fix issue for using clients configuration when component clients unset
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-24 05:31:56.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/client_plugin.py', 'contrib/heat_keystoneclient_v2/heat_keystoneclient_v2/client.py', 'heat/common/heat_keystoneclient.py'], 'message': 'Fix issue for using clients configuration when component clients unset

Since component clients options are already registered in heat.common.config, when
the [clients] are configured with options like ca_cert while [clients_glance], [clients_cinder]
without configured these options, getattr call will return None instead of raising exception.
Fix this issue so that Heat can load the common clients configurations when clients component
sections not set.

Change-Id: Ic3dc44017c55e4437181e3b06f20640b899185cc
Closes-Bug: #1385021
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue for using clients configuration when component clients unset

Since component clients options are already registered in heat.common.config, when
the [clients] are configured with options like ca_cert while [clients_glance], [clients_cinder]
without configured these options, getattr call will return None instead of raising exception.
Fix this issue so that Heat can load the common clients configurations when clients component
sections not set.

Change-Id: Ic3dc44017c55e4437181e3b06f20640b899185cc
Closes-Bug: #1385021

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-23 17:33:11.000000000', 'files': ['elements/iso/cleanup.d/100-build-iso', 'elements/iso/cleanup.d/efiboot.img'], 'message': "iso element to use 'search --label' for grub

Current iso element uses 'search --file' to find the
grub root.  This is a wrong approach as it may find
some other partition containing /vmlinuz. Instead modify
it to search for grub root by the label of ISO image.

Closes-Bug: 1384826
Change-Id: Id4217be3420597bed2f80a96788928259ec91582
"}]
commit_message:
iso element to use 'search --label' for grub

Current iso element uses 'search --file' to find the
grub root.  This is a wrong approach as it may find
some other partition containing /vmlinuz. Instead modify
it to search for grub root by the label of ISO image.

Closes-Bug: 1384826
Change-Id: Id4217be3420597bed2f80a96788928259ec91582

commit_message:
Fix to setup.cfg for dateutil

Previously we had not updated setup.cfg to properly install dateutil.
All the tests ran fine, but 'python setup.py install' did not put
dateutil in the proper place, which made the server fail when installed.

Change-Id: Icc468ff41c0d1a70c5dccb9966ce7ed41207c67e

commit_message:
Configuration file plugins support for nailgun

    - Task serialization logic for pre/post hooks
    - PluginSerializer object added
    - API for interaction with Plugins db schema
    General API requests supported
    GET/POST /plugins
    GET/PUT/DELETE /plugins/<plugin_id>
    - Plugins and ClustersPlugins db models added
    ClusterPlugins used to identify enabled plugins for a
    given cluster
    - Configuration uploading logic stored in Plugin wrapper

Co-authored-by: Dima Shulyak <dshulyak@mirantis.com>
Co-authored-by: Evgeniy L <eli@mirantis.com>

implements: blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel
Change-Id: I986f5be9ed3c3adaf7583d1bfc546cbe705db9ec

subject: Refactor tempest verification and tests for it
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-10-24 14:32:12.000000000', 'files': ['tools/rally.bash_completion', 'tests/unit/benchmark/context/test_tempest.py', 'rally/benchmark/context/tempest.py', 'rally/verification/verifiers/tempest/tempest.py', 'rally/orchestrator/api.py', 'rally/cmd/commands/use.py', 'tests/unit/cmd/commands/test_verify.py', 'rally/cmd/commands/verify.py', 'tests/unit/benchmark/scenarios/tempest/test_tempest.py', 'rally/cmd/cliutils.py', 'rally/cmd/envutils.py', 'tests/unit/verification/verifiers/test_tempest.py'], 'message': 'Refactor tempest verification and tests for it

Class `verification.verifiers.tempest.Tempest` contains next changes:
  Output from installation of virtual environment is not useful for users,
  so visibility of this output was changed and now only in debug mode it
  will be printed.

  The status of verification will be changed to 'FAILED' if something will
  go wrong in subproccess.call

  Two variables contain word 'tempest' in their names. This is redundant,
  so they were renamed:
    Tempest.tempest_base_path => Tempest.base_repo
    Tempest.tempest_path => Tempest._path

  Construction "os.path.join(Tempest.path, some_path)" was moved to method
  `Tempest.path`, since it used in many places.

  Method `Tempest.parse_results` should not be static, because it needed
  inner variable `Tempest.log_file_raw`, so this was fixed.

  "git remote update" is not needed in Tempest installation, so we can
  remove this call and decrease time of installation.

In `rally.cmd.commands.verify.start` command, several issues were fixed:
  First function argument changed to "set_name" instead of "deploy_id".
  Reason: "deploy_id" have default value, so it should be the first in
          arguments. It will simplify command for end-users(launch
          'rally verify start <set_name>' instead of
          'rally verify start --set <set_name>').

  Task commands have cool feature: save task_id in global variables, so
  results cmd can print the last task, without setting it id. This feature
  is ported in verification.

Tests for verification contains a lot of tests, so they are splitted
to separate classes(TempestVerifyTestCase, TempestInstallAndUninstallTestCase
and etc). Also, new tests were added.

Change-Id: I08a52a1e3ceb468ba619049573bcfe642aecbcaf
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor tempest verification and tests for it

Class `verification.verifiers.tempest.Tempest` contains next changes:
  Output from installation of virtual environment is not useful for users,
  so visibility of this output was changed and now only in debug mode it
  will be printed.

  The status of verification will be changed to 'FAILED' if something will
  go wrong in subproccess.call

  Two variables contain word 'tempest' in their names. This is redundant,
  so they were renamed:
    Tempest.tempest_base_path => Tempest.base_repo
    Tempest.tempest_path => Tempest._path

  Construction "os.path.join(Tempest.path, some_path)" was moved to method
  `Tempest.path`, since it used in many places.

  Method `Tempest.parse_results` should not be static, because it needed
  inner variable `Tempest.log_file_raw`, so this was fixed.

  "git remote update" is not needed in Tempest installation, so we can
  remove this call and decrease time of installation.

In `rally.cmd.commands.verify.start` command, several issues were fixed:
  First function argument changed to "set_name" instead of "deploy_id".
  Reason: "deploy_id" have default value, so it should be the first in
          arguments. It will simplify command for end-users(launch
          'rally verify start <set_name>' instead of
          'rally verify start --set <set_name>').

  Task commands have cool feature: save task_id in global variables, so
  results cmd can print the last task, without setting it id. This feature
  is ported in verification.

Tests for verification contains a lot of tests, so they are splitted
to separate classes(TempestVerifyTestCase, TempestInstallAndUninstallTestCase
and etc). Also, new tests were added.

Change-Id: I08a52a1e3ceb468ba619049573bcfe642aecbcaf

commit_message:
Remove storing of password in browser

Plaintext password was stored in localStorage. This was removed and replaced
by token.
Username is still stored -- we display it in the navigation bar.
Tests were updated to use only the token and a check for username in navbar
was added.

Change-Id: Id9a053e119f6826eda5472629f7d09e618297403
Implements: blueprint access-control-master-node-improvments

subject: Map CloudConfig attributes to CloudConfig.config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-21 23:12:30.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/cloud_config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_cloud_config.py'], 'message': 'Map CloudConfig attributes to CloudConfig.config

Treat the CloudConfig object as if it has the config attributes directly.
And add some simple tests.

This makes it easier to replace an argparse.Namespace() object with a
CloudConfig object.  It also might make initialization of some of the
default attributes unnecessary.  An example of this usage is in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/129795/1/openstackclient/shell.py

Change-Id: I00ced540cf94742e8cb738f8f0767445ffeb4bfe
'}]
commit_message:
Map CloudConfig attributes to CloudConfig.config

Treat the CloudConfig object as if it has the config attributes directly.
And add some simple tests.

This makes it easier to replace an argparse.Namespace() object with a
CloudConfig object.  It also might make initialization of some of the
default attributes unnecessary.  An example of this usage is in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/129795/1/openstackclient/shell.py

Change-Id: I00ced540cf94742e8cb738f8f0767445ffeb4bfe

Outdated tokens will be cleaned (removed) to avoid running out
of space in long term.

commit_message:
Increased keystone token expiration time to 24h

Long lived token will allow to use it in OSTF tests and in
long running upgrade where 1h token might not be sufficient.
Such token will also improve user experience when we switch
to storing token instead of storing user credentials.

Change-Id: I81ba5c11034fca8a332ec2e92f1f9804523e14f6
Implements: blueprint access-control-master-node-improvments

commit_message:
Remove usage of admin_token

* Added new tenant/project: services
* Added two new users with admin roles to 'services' project:
  ostf and nailgun
* Use generated passwords for ostf and nailgun keystone users and
  remove admin_token
* OSTF and nailgun will use their users to validate keystone tokens
 instead of admin_token
* Added new services and endpoints for keystone, ostf, nailgun. Now
 it's possible to use keystone service catalog to discover their URLs

DocImpact

commit_message:
Remove deprecated function i18n.install('heat')

Since i18n.install() is deprecated, remove it from heat codes and
import i18n._() to where it needed.

blueprint oslo-i18n
Change-Id: Icefada18b5a33112b425cd90d31d3a6a5f06188a
(cherry picked from commit 11c1b62052e8ffe3c1af320aaced645a19868dff)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-24 02:38:57.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/openstack/common/excutils.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/fileutils.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/log.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/strutils.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/__init__.py', 'keystone/common/wsgi.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/_i18n.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/versionutils.py', 'etc/keystone.conf.sample', 'keystone/openstack/common/service.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/eventlet_backdoor.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/policy.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/processutils.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/timeutils.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/jsonutils.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/loopingcall.py'], 'message': "Sync modules from oslo-incubator

Sync the following modules with oslo-incubator commit
2acb6502268f7cc973c2b37ee49b73de81b8b69d :

- eventlet_backdoor
- fileutils
- log
- loopingcall
- policy
- processutils
- service
- versionutils

Use mask_password from strutils.

Remove excutils, jsonutils, strutils, and timeutils since those
modules aren't used anymore.

These modules are chosen because they're easy to sync. The goal of
the next sync is to remove the rest of the deprecated modules, but
this is blocked until Keystone uses the oslo.config config generator.

Change-Id: I7a03842d800a94a7a231da2a497be8937318857d
"}]
commit_message:
Sync modules from oslo-incubator

Sync the following modules with oslo-incubator commit
2acb6502268f7cc973c2b37ee49b73de81b8b69d :

- eventlet_backdoor
- fileutils
- log
- loopingcall
- policy
- processutils
- service
- versionutils

Use mask_password from strutils.

Remove excutils, jsonutils, strutils, and timeutils since those
modules aren't used anymore.

These modules are chosen because they're easy to sync. The goal of
the next sync is to remove the rest of the deprecated modules, but
this is blocked until Keystone uses the oslo.config config generator.

Change-Id: I7a03842d800a94a7a231da2a497be8937318857d

revisions:

Change-Id: Ib73cb3846feb6ccb2e45859458008a1701aa2231
Closes-Bug: #1382226

commit_message:
Use correct object when deleting

SwiftSignalHandle was using the client object instead
of the client plugin object to check for Not Found
during delete. Also normalized access to the client
and plugin as well as remove a few pep8 warning items.

Change-Id: Ib73cb3846feb6ccb2e45859458008a1701aa2231
Closes-Bug: #1382226

commit_message:
Allow to customize log_name for services

This patch allows us to customize log_name for:
- proxy-server
- container-server
- object-server
- account-server

Which may be usefull for log collecting/parsing. Defaults remain
as they were before the patch.

Change-Id: I173652ec5bbe8d4382e10db4510d91aebceacab5

commit_message:
Fixing validation exception for valid security group

Now casting the id of the allowed security group to a
six.text_type() to avoid type mismatching when using ids.

Change-Id: Iff2e442501d9c85c2b73c9a36114728830b04701
Closes-Bug:  #1384743

subject: Add simple multi thread broker
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-10-24 11:56:46.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_broker.py', 'rally/broker.py'], 'message': 'Add simple multi thread broker

To make creation/deletion of resources in different context it's very usefull
to use broker module. Where we are publishing to queue "tasks" and consuming them
from different threads.

In case of working with OpenStack resources we should cache initialized clients
and initialized clients can't be shared between threads.

So to be able to cache clients each thread has it's own *cache* dict

Co-authored-by: Mikhail Dubov <mdubov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ic67bd45df375de98140c3fdd20a1af129f0886f0
'}]
commit_message:
Add simple multi thread broker

To make creation/deletion of resources in different context it's very usefull
to use broker module. Where we are publishing to queue "tasks" and consuming them
from different threads.

In case of working with OpenStack resources we should cache initialized clients
and initialized clients can't be shared between threads.

So to be able to cache clients each thread has it's own *cache* dict

Co-authored-by: Mikhail Dubov <mdubov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ic67bd45df375de98140c3fdd20a1af129f0886f0

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-23 14:03:47.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/utils/openstack/neutron.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/utils/test_neutron.py'], 'message': 'Correcting error in NeutronClientRemoteWrapper._get_adapters

changes
* fixing the list comprehension in _get_adapters when aggregating all hosts

commit_message:
Validate get_item for presence of a range key

Raise ValidationError if table schema has a range key
and get_item request misses a value for the range key

Change-Id: Iff3d72f0539e503476feb1e7400242057abc2e3d
Fixes-bug: 1290878

This patch removes the step of clearing the consistency
hash from the DB before a topology sync. This will ensure
that inconsistency will be detected if the topology sync
fails.

This logic was originally there to make sure the hash header
was not present on the topology sync call to the backend.
However, the hash header is ignored by the backend in a sync
call so it wasn't necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1379510

(cherry picked from commit 24e4110eb284078775496501ff81630eb1619c11)
"}]
commit_message:
Big Switch: Don't clear hash before sync

This patch removes the step of clearing the consistency
hash from the DB before a topology sync. This will ensure
that inconsistency will be detected if the topology sync
fails.

This logic was originally there to make sure the hash header
was not present on the topology sync call to the backend.
However, the hash header is ignored by the backend in a sync
call so it wasn't necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1379510
Change-Id: I2d58fa2aea3b692834d64192d06ace727c7df8a0
(cherry picked from commit 24e4110eb284078775496501ff81630eb1619c11)

commit_message:
Add manila specific hacking checks

Add manila specific hacking checks (copied over from nova) to test:
- [M319] Validate that debug level logs are not translated.
- [M323] Ensure that the _() function is explicitly imported to ensure
  proper translations.
- [M325] str() cannot be used on an exception.  Remove use or use
  six.text_type()
- [M326] Translated messages cannot be concatenated.  String should be
  included in translated message.

Also include some tests for the above (copied from nova and adjusted).

Rework HACKING.rst to remove the content that is in the global hacking
file and add in the manila specific rules.

Change-Id: I530609a183c81ba942623b73d5f62cd338b04211

Coerce the Content-Length of the custom error message to a string, not an
integer.  Some pure Python WSGI servers aren't strict and violate the WSGI
specification by automatically converting the value to a string.  Apache,
however, *is* strict, and considers this a 500 Internal Error

Fixes bug 1306963

Change-Id: I9b82ceee096b00c21c3b230dc67701bc40629968
(cherry picked from commit 381d9ba941e93386000dd29b9426358efb7713f7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a response header bug in the error middleware

Coerce the Content-Length of the custom error message to a string, not an
integer.  Some pure Python WSGI servers aren't strict and violate the WSGI
specification by automatically converting the value to a string.  Apache,
however, *is* strict, and considers this a 500 Internal Error

Fixes bug 1306963

Change-Id: I9b82ceee096b00c21c3b230dc67701bc40629968
(cherry picked from commit 381d9ba941e93386000dd29b9426358efb7713f7)

commit_message:
Improve plugins and apply loading for runners and contexts plugins

Provide plugins loading for runners and contexts, improve samples.
Plugins now can be loaded from ~/.rally/plugins and /opt/rally/plugins
and any it's subdirectories.

Closes-Bug: #1320942

Change-Id: I213086e7eae17e297c398c301f5ed8d2331d951e

There is a situation, when  we request resource data
from db during loadbalancer resource deleting. If
there is no such data, NotFound exception raised and
stack delete failed with this error. To prevent this
behaviour, there is a need to catch NotFound exception
in delete method of loadbalancer.

Closes-bug: #1381700
'}]
commit_message:
Catch NotFound error during loadbalancer deleting

There is a situation, when  we request resource data
from db during loadbalancer resource deleting. If
there is no such data, NotFound exception raised and
stack delete failed with this error. To prevent this
behaviour, there is a need to catch NotFound exception
in delete method of loadbalancer.

Change-Id: Ie52bc3059e91bd25effc53bbd255bce6948509ac
Closes-bug: #1381700

commit_message:
Fix passing workflow input via UI

 * When we are using UI to pass workflow input
   to execution, we always pass it as json string.
   We need to prevent using extra json.dumps on string.

revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2014-10-23 20:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample', 'cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp_nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_coraid.py', 'cinder/tests/test_smbfs.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_remotefs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/remotefs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py'], 'message': 'NFS Security Enhancements: allows secure NFS environment setup

This patch allows an OpenStack environment to run as a secure NAS
environment from the client and server perspective, including having
root squash enabled and not running file operations as the 'root'
user. This also sets Cinder file permissions as 660: removing
other/world file access.

The "nas_secure_file_permissions" option controls the setting of file
permissions when Cinder volumes are created. The option defaults to
"auto" to gracefully handle upgrade scenarios. When set to "auto",
a check is done during Cinder startup to determine if there are
existing Cinder volumes: no volumes will set the option to 'true',
and use secure file permissions. The detection of existing volumes will
set the option to 'false', and use the current insecure method of
handling file permissions.

The "nas_secure_file_operations" option controls whether file
operations are run as the 'root' user or the current OpenStack
'process' user. The option defaults to "auto" to gracefully handle
upgrade scenarios. When set to "auto", a check is done during Cinder
startup to determine if there are existing Cinder volumes: no volumes
will set the option to 'true', be secure and do NOT run as the 'root'
user. The detection of existing volumes will set the option to 'false',
and use the current method of running operations as the 'root' user.
For new installations, a 'marker file' is written so that subsequent
restarts of Cinder will know what the original determination had been.

This patch enables this functionality only for the NFS driver.
Other similar drivers can use this code to enable the same
functionality with the same config options.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I3d25f593beab7f5462576b14ab62d13d8c53e7c6
Implements: blueprint secure-nfs
Partial-Bug: 1260679
'}]
commit_message:
NFS Security Enhancements: allows secure NFS environment setup

This patch allows an OpenStack environment to run as a secure NAS
environment from the client and server perspective, including having
root squash enabled and not running file operations as the 'root'
user. This also sets Cinder file permissions as 660: removing
other/world file access.

The "nas_secure_file_permissions" option controls the setting of file
permissions when Cinder volumes are created. The option defaults to
"auto" to gracefully handle upgrade scenarios. When set to "auto",
a check is done during Cinder startup to determine if there are
existing Cinder volumes: no volumes will set the option to 'true',
and use secure file permissions. The detection of existing volumes will
set the option to 'false', and use the current insecure method of
handling file permissions.

The "nas_secure_file_operations" option controls whether file
operations are run as the 'root' user or the current OpenStack
'process' user. The option defaults to "auto" to gracefully handle
upgrade scenarios. When set to "auto", a check is done during Cinder
startup to determine if there are existing Cinder volumes: no volumes
will set the option to 'true', be secure and do NOT run as the 'root'
user. The detection of existing volumes will set the option to 'false',
and use the current method of running operations as the 'root' user.
For new installations, a 'marker file' is written so that subsequent
restarts of Cinder will know what the original determination had been.

This patch enables this functionality only for the NFS driver.
Other similar drivers can use this code to enable the same
functionality with the same config options.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I3d25f593beab7f5462576b14ab62d13d8c53e7c6
Implements: blueprint secure-nfs
Partial-Bug: 1260679

subject: Remove variable case requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-01 10:02:29.000000000', 'files': ['HACKING.rst'], 'message': "Remove variable case requirement

Although the requirement disambiguates exported from non-exported vars,
which is useful, few if any of our existing scripts apply it. This makes
it difficult to enforce on new commits. I'd rather not have HACKING
rules which are unenforced.

I'd not object to this being reintroduced along with a cleanup to
existing scripts. I do think that'll be impractical but if someone feels
strongly they're welcome to do the work.

Change-Id: Iafde3c94caeb81f5daf0b97bffc61155fcadee76
"}]
commit_message:
Remove variable case requirement

Although the requirement disambiguates exported from non-exported vars,
which is useful, few if any of our existing scripts apply it. This makes
it difficult to enforce on new commits. I'd rather not have HACKING
rules which are unenforced.

I'd not object to this being reintroduced along with a cleanup to
existing scripts. I do think that'll be impractical but if someone feels
strongly they're welcome to do the work.

Change-Id: Iafde3c94caeb81f5daf0b97bffc61155fcadee76

get new token from Keystone for this case. New function
token_expires_soon() added to keystone module.

commit_message:
Get new auth token for ramdisk if old will expire soon

PXE driver prepares auth token for ramdisk, if this token near
expiration deploy will be fail. This patch modify PXE driver,
get new token from Keystone for this case. New function
token_expires_soon() added to keystone module.

Closes-Bug: #1377168
Change-Id: I215e2ec679b510152e2d140234594f7596e602af

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-20 12:49:51.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/common/cms.py'], 'message': 'set close_fds=True in Popen

The current way of using Popen does not close pipes properly,
and therefore long-running keystone processes, which depends on
keystoneclient.common.cms for data sigining, eventually hit
open file limit and stop working. Passing close_fds=True seems
to have solved the problem.

Change-Id: Ife452ab6843c1af5eb39debb8db453e45f78cba9
Closes-Bug: 1382906
'}]
commit_message:
set close_fds=True in Popen

The current way of using Popen does not close pipes properly,
and therefore long-running keystone processes, which depends on
keystoneclient.common.cms for data sigining, eventually hit
open file limit and stop working. Passing close_fds=True seems
to have solved the problem.

Change-Id: Ife452ab6843c1af5eb39debb8db453e45f78cba9
Closes-Bug: 1382906

commit_message:
Create 'quota' table in folsom_initial

When using the stable icehouse branch
folsom_initial db migration does not create quotas table
for a plugin which had db quota support (quota-ext).

This bug was fixed as part of bug 1207402 in master.
Since this bug cannot be back ported, we back port only
the quota table related fix.

Closes-bug: #1372678

Change-Id: I933aaefb50e32234eaad5557322e4c89af2a47d0

subject: Retry on closing of luks encrypted volume in case device is busy
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-26 14:37:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/volume/encryptors/luks.py'], 'message': "Retry on closing of luks encrypted volume in case device is busy

We're seeing races in the gate on detach of an encrypted volume where
the device is busy so the detach fails, which causes the delete of the
volume on the cinder side to fail because the volume is still in use and
then Tempest times out waiting for the volume to be deleted.

This simply adds a retry to close the encryption device.  I use
attempts=3 since that's what we use for lvremove.

Closes-Bug: #1374458

Change-Id: Ia0667da7dee247ba8c3338b296244b2a71d1045d
"}]
commit_message:
Retry on closing of luks encrypted volume in case device is busy

We're seeing races in the gate on detach of an encrypted volume where
the device is busy so the detach fails, which causes the delete of the
volume on the cinder side to fail because the volume is still in use and
then Tempest times out waiting for the volume to be deleted.

This simply adds a retry to close the encryption device.  I use
attempts=3 since that's what we use for lvremove.

Closes-Bug: #1374458

Change-Id: Ia0667da7dee247ba8c3338b296244b2a71d1045d

commit_message:
Set owner+group from control file

Add keys 'uid' and 'gid' to control file. The values may be UID/GIDs or
names. In either case, the value is checked against the passwd/group
database to ensure it exists.

Change-Id: I1730a126cf024755635043b1a0f70006ab22c046

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-05-05 18:37:46.000000000', 'files': ['swift/__init__.py', 'pbr_setup.py', 'setup.py', 'pkg_setup.py', 'test/unit/common/test_init.py'], 'message': "Make PBR based setup completely optional

 * Tradtional setup.py is available as pkg_setup.py
 * PBR based setup.py is avaialble as pbr_setup.py

If you run setup.py with pbr installed you get pbr_setup.py otherwise,
just regular setuptools (default).

You can also choose to use either xxx_setup.py file explicitly (i.e.
never use pbr based setup even if it's installed, or use pbr based
setup where pbr is installed at build time)

Change-Id: Ifcd64c35abd1fae1c72909d5b724b36020a0c698
"}]
commit_message:
Make PBR based setup completely optional

 * Tradtional setup.py is available as pkg_setup.py
 * PBR based setup.py is avaialble as pbr_setup.py

If you run setup.py with pbr installed you get pbr_setup.py otherwise,
just regular setuptools (default).

You can also choose to use either xxx_setup.py file explicitly (i.e.
never use pbr based setup even if it's installed, or use pbr based
setup where pbr is installed at build time)

Change-Id: Ifcd64c35abd1fae1c72909d5b724b36020a0c698

can't connect to mirrors.fedoraproject.org over https

---
[root@test ~]# urlgrabber -d 1,debug.txt https://mirrors.fedoraproject.org/metalink?repo=epel-6
* About to connect() to mirrors.fedoraproject.org port 443 (#0)
*   Trying 140.211.169.197... * connected

commit_message:
Update ca-certificates for HP Cloud centos6 images

The current HP cloud official centos6 images ("CentOS 6.3 Server
64-bit 20130116" - c1f9f404-39c2-4e83-b4bb-90d5ead16a36) by default
can't connect to mirrors.fedoraproject.org over https

---
[root@test ~]# urlgrabber -d 1,debug.txt https://mirrors.fedoraproject.org/metalink?repo=epel-6
* About to connect() to mirrors.fedoraproject.org port 443 (#0)
*   Trying 140.211.169.197... * connected
* Connected to mirrors.fedoraproject.org (140.211.169.197) port 443 (#0)
* Initializing NSS with certpath: sql:/etc/pki/nssdb
*   CAfile: /etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt
  CApath: none
* NSS error -8092
* Closing connection #0
* SSL connect error
---

This requires an update of ca-certificates before it will work.

Change-Id: I9c5e595aa2b8e86188cb7db658ce4b630e6d0774

subject: Allow extraction of list items
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-10-21 10:32:01.000000000', 'files': ['os_apply_config/tests/test_apply_config.py', 'os_apply_config/apply_config.py'], 'message': "Allow extraction of list items

OAC can be used to get a key from metadata by supplying EG '--key A'.
You can also extract an item from a dict, EG '--key A.B'.
However, if A is a list, there's no way to get an item out of the list.

Extend the expression language (if that's not too grand a term) to
support this. EG '--key A.0' gets the first item out of the list A.
'--key A.1.B' gets B out of the second item of list A (which must be a
dict).

Change-Id: I406cbd2d974544ed5948e137359629184d8ee156
"}]
commit_message:
Allow extraction of list items

OAC can be used to get a key from metadata by supplying EG '--key A'.
You can also extract an item from a dict, EG '--key A.B'.
However, if A is a list, there's no way to get an item out of the list.

Extend the expression language (if that's not too grand a term) to
support this. EG '--key A.0' gets the first item out of the list A.
'--key A.1.B' gets B out of the second item of list A (which must be a
dict).

Change-Id: I406cbd2d974544ed5948e137359629184d8ee156

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-10-06 07:55:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cells/state.py', 'nova/tests/cells/test_cells_state_manager.py'], 'message': "Fix CellStateManagerFile init to failure

Currently, specifying a cells_config file in nova.conf causes
CellStateManager to fail and in turn stops the nova-cells service from
starting. The reason is that CellsManager creates an instance of
CellStateManager with no arguments. CellStateManager __new__ runs and
creates an instance of CellStateManagerFile which runs __new__ and
__init__ with cell_state_cls and cells_config_path set. At this point
__new__ returns CellStateManagerFile and the new instance's __init__
method is invoked (CellStateManagerFile.__init__) with the original
arguments (there weren't any) which then results in:
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova self.state_manager =
cell_state_manager()
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova TypeError: __init__() takes
exactly 3 arguments (1 given)

It seems reasonable for CellStateManagerFile to derive the
cells_config_path info for itself so I have updated the code with that
change and added unit tests to catch this bug and to check that the
correct managers are still returned

Closes-Bug: #1314677
(cherry picked from commit 695191fa89387d96e60120ff32965493c844e7f5)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/cells/test_cells_state_manager.py

Change-Id: I9021640515142a3ca95c2d9e7b03e19b529bc175
"}]
commit_message:
Fix CellStateManagerFile init to failure

Currently, specifying a cells_config file in nova.conf causes
CellStateManager to fail and in turn stops the nova-cells service from
starting. The reason is that CellsManager creates an instance of
CellStateManager with no arguments. CellStateManager __new__ runs and
creates an instance of CellStateManagerFile which runs __new__ and
__init__ with cell_state_cls and cells_config_path set. At this point
__new__ returns CellStateManagerFile and the new instance's __init__
method is invoked (CellStateManagerFile.__init__) with the original
arguments (there weren't any) which then results in:
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova self.state_manager =
cell_state_manager()
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova TypeError: __init__() takes
exactly 3 arguments (1 given)

It seems reasonable for CellStateManagerFile to derive the
cells_config_path info for itself so I have updated the code with that
change and added unit tests to catch this bug and to check that the
correct managers are still returned

Closes-Bug: #1314677
(cherry picked from commit 695191fa89387d96e60120ff32965493c844e7f5)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/cells/test_cells_state_manager.py

Change-Id: I9021640515142a3ca95c2d9e7b03e19b529bc175

subject: Make rdo-release install safe
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-20 20:47:18.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rdo-release/pre-install.d/10-rdo-release-repo'], 'message': 'Make rdo-release install safe

Like the epel element, this may be applied to a system that already
has rdo-release installed.  If that happens yum exits non-zero
because for some reason it considers "nothing to do" to be an error.

This simply checks for the existence of the rdo-release rpm before
attempting to install it.

Change-Id: I5867ca074cc1afa843ef1e0f85c1c9b6f2deb403
'}]
commit_message:
Make rdo-release install safe

Like the epel element, this may be applied to a system that already
has rdo-release installed.  If that happens yum exits non-zero
because for some reason it considers "nothing to do" to be an error.

This simply checks for the existence of the rdo-release rpm before
attempting to install it.

Change-Id: I5867ca074cc1afa843ef1e0f85c1c9b6f2deb403
