commit_message:
Add a new openstack-specs repo under the control of the TC

One of the takeaways from the exercise about kilo priorities was oslo is
not the right home for all cross project discussions. We need a new home
for cross project specs, and since the TC is our governing technical
committee this repo should be under their management.

Change-Id: Id9393dfc2c7f1f883a5f20d85f7ecb79e2c52063

subject: Fix resource leakage in messaging.test_queues
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-23 02:20:34.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/messaging/test_queues.py'], 'message': 'Fix resource leakage in messaging.test_queues

Test messaging.test_queues.test_delete_queue does pop 1 element from
shared list (self.queues which is being used by other tests as well
as in resource cleanup) and then delete request is done.

In case where delete request fails then it cause other tests to fail
and resource leakage as element has been removed from self.queues
even before actual deletion.

Individual test should not be side-effecting mutable class variables
that are used by other tests. So merging delete tests with create tests.

Closes-Bug: #1377031

Change-Id: If24a903160e716a685d7121e0968881542f072fc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix resource leakage in messaging.test_queues

Test messaging.test_queues.test_delete_queue does pop 1 element from
shared list (self.queues which is being used by other tests as well
as in resource cleanup) and then delete request is done.

In case where delete request fails then it cause other tests to fail
and resource leakage as element has been removed from self.queues
even before actual deletion.

Individual test should not be side-effecting mutable class variables
that are used by other tests. So merging delete tests with create tests.

Closes-Bug: #1377031

Change-Id: If24a903160e716a685d7121e0968881542f072fc

subject: Handle extra spaces in merge-svc-map-files
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-20 17:16:52.000000000', 'files': ['elements/svc-map/extra-data.d/10-merge-svc-map-files'], 'message': 'Handle extra spaces in merge-svc-map-files

During internal testing we are getting the following error from
merge-svc-map-files
File "/tmp/image.K2MYCphY/hooks/extra-data.d/10-merge-svc-map-files", line 54, in main
    with open(data_path, 'r') as dataFile:
IOError: [Errno 21] Is a directory: '...diskimage-builder/elements/svc-map'

Somehow IMAGE_ELEMENT contains a extra white space that manifests itself
as an element without a name. It is very hard to find where this is coming from so
instead this patch makes merge-svc-map-files more robost to this situation

Change-Id: Id1500ead8a77d691408617dcdc4e095bc5775be8
'}]
commit_message:
Handle extra spaces in merge-svc-map-files

During internal testing we are getting the following error from
merge-svc-map-files
File "/tmp/image.K2MYCphY/hooks/extra-data.d/10-merge-svc-map-files", line 54, in main
    with open(data_path, 'r') as dataFile:
IOError: [Errno 21] Is a directory: '...diskimage-builder/elements/svc-map'

Somehow IMAGE_ELEMENT contains a extra white space that manifests itself
as an element without a name. It is very hard to find where this is coming from so
instead this patch makes merge-svc-map-files more robost to this situation

Change-Id: Id1500ead8a77d691408617dcdc4e095bc5775be8

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-10-21 10:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['block-storage.yaml'], 'message': "Add block completion signal

In I973d197245ed32612bde9209479e6ae3a443fc69, the signal_transport was
set to NO_SIGNAL to prevent the resource staying CREATE_IN_PROGRESS
forever. This means that Heat reports the stack is configured before it
actually is.

The correct fix was to add completion-signal to BlockStorageConfig.
However now there's a BlockStorage0AllNodesDeployment, we simply have to
receive the signal from allNodesConfig by setting the deployment
signal-transport.

Change-Id: I1f6408ca39fddd146e7aae140f61d265bbf563ec
"}]
commit_message:
Add block completion signal

In I973d197245ed32612bde9209479e6ae3a443fc69, the signal_transport was
set to NO_SIGNAL to prevent the resource staying CREATE_IN_PROGRESS
forever. This means that Heat reports the stack is configured before it
actually is.

The correct fix was to add completion-signal to BlockStorageConfig.
However now there's a BlockStorage0AllNodesDeployment, we simply have to
receive the signal from allNodesConfig by setting the deployment
signal-transport.

Change-Id: I1f6408ca39fddd146e7aae140f61d265bbf563ec

commit_message:
Improve nfs-server to support multiple shares and options

With this we aim at making the nfs-server element capable of
deploying an arbitrary number of shares and to define for each
a list of clients allowed and the respective export options.

subject: Update use of open() in object API
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-10-13 15:34:46.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/api/test_object_store_v1.py', 'openstackclient/api/object_store_v1.py'], 'message': "Update use of open() in object API

* Switch to use io.open() for py3 compatibility and simpler testing.
* Open files in 'rb' mode to avoid translation on Windows

Previously tests simply relied on files that were present in the
repository to run tests using open().  Change the filenames to ensure
that no longer happens.

requests_mock doesn't have a way to match against the request body for
PUT/POST; an attempt to add a new Matcher to do that worked but it
needs to subclass the currently private adapter._Matcher class or
duplicate most of its functionality.

Change-Id: I8c30b41db20af8ecafe67e760e872fc08adec905
"}]
commit_message:
Update use of open() in object API

* Switch to use io.open() for py3 compatibility and simpler testing.
* Open files in 'rb' mode to avoid translation on Windows

Previously tests simply relied on files that were present in the
repository to run tests using open().  Change the filenames to ensure
that no longer happens.

requests_mock doesn't have a way to match against the request body for
PUT/POST; an attempt to add a new Matcher to do that worked but it
needs to subclass the currently private adapter._Matcher class or
duplicate most of its functionality.

Change-Id: I8c30b41db20af8ecafe67e760e872fc08adec905

commit_message:
Remove pip install --pre

We were installing some packages with support for prerelease versions in
expectation of needing it in our CI. This turns out to not be needed so
we should remove it.

Change-Id: I7ae440d3534e33144942c2230a88cf54f8a153d3

commit_message:
Add config option for XML support in Networking

The first step to removing XML in Kilo is making XML testing optional.
Stable test configs will need to be updated to enable this feature to prevent
regressions in stable releases.

Change-Id: I30b9565e01c623814a9c503c4b1c26642afed878

commit_message:
Convert all HTML doc to RST

The motivation for this conversion is to have DevStack's docs be
generated using a more familair workflow for OpenStack projects, using
Sphinx.

Changing from raw HTML to RST will also make it easier to contribute
more documentation, as well as making edits less of a hassle.

The majority of the work was done by using Pandoc to convert from HTML
to RST, with minor edits to the output to remove errors in Sphinx.

Change-Id: I9636017965aeade37b950ddf5bdb0c22ab9004bd

subject: Correct CA cert argument for glanceclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-23 11:59:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/glance.py'], 'message': "Correct CA cert argument for glanceclient

Heat need to pass the CA cert to glanceclient to load image data
during stack creation when glance api is configured with SSL.
Currently the client is passing the wrong cert key to glanceclient.
The key should be 'cacert' instead of 'ca_file'.

Change-Id: Ie542dda1354776e62507240c917c1cffbc222f17
Closes-Bug: #1384626
"}]
commit_message:
Correct CA cert argument for glanceclient

Heat need to pass the CA cert to glanceclient to load image data
during stack creation when glance api is configured with SSL.
Currently the client is passing the wrong cert key to glanceclient.
The key should be 'cacert' instead of 'ca_file'.

Change-Id: Ie542dda1354776e62507240c917c1cffbc222f17
Closes-Bug: #1384626

commit_message:
Save test output of run_tests.sh to textfile

Using tee to save the rest output of run_tests.sh.
It is helpful to locate the failure you concerned when there are
lots of failures. And use don't need to redirect the output from
command line.

It is also aligned with the consequence code: "cat run_tests.log".

Bug #1219690

Change-Id: I868c0fc72e4139470956929668db337ca63f0155

commit_message:
Move unit tests from test_backend_ldap

There were a couple of unit tests in test_backend_ldap for
functions in keystone.common.ldap. Unit tests should be in
keystone.tests.unit.common.test_ldap because they don't need to
run multiple times for different configurations of the ldap
backend.

Change-Id: Ifcfd2c5610eb6870e6876af671a3fbdd779c659b

subject: PKI and PKIZ tokens unnecessary whitespace removed
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 8978, 'name': 'Marek Denis', 'email': 'marek.denis+openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'marek-denis'}, {'_account_id': 9098, 'name': 'Nathan Kinder', 'email': 'nkinder@redhat.com', 'username': 'nkinder'}, {'_account_id': 11428, 'name': 'Ajaya Agrawal', 'email': 'ajku.agr@gmail.com', 'username': 'ajayaa'}, {'_account_id': 13055, 'name': 'Alexander Makarov', 'email': 'ajiekcahdp.makapob@gmail.com', 'username': 'amakarov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-10-23 12:08:49.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/pkiz.py', 'keystone/token/providers/pki.py', 'keystone/tests/test_utils.py', 'keystone/common/utils.py'], 'message': "PKI and PKIZ tokens unnecessary whitespace removed

In the race to produce smaller PKI tokens, we've overlooked
that we can produce smaller JSON bodies by removing all whitespace
between structural characters.

This patch offers a solution by overloading
item_separator and key_separator in class SmarterEncoder
used to produce json response.

Change-Id: Id7fcc82a28359e85feac57f9469f2bcd9192ee50
Closes-Bug: #1348262
"}]
commit_message:
PKI and PKIZ tokens unnecessary whitespace removed

In the race to produce smaller PKI tokens, we've overlooked
that we can produce smaller JSON bodies by removing all whitespace
between structural characters.

This patch offers a solution by overloading
item_separator and key_separator in class SmarterEncoder
used to produce json response.

Change-Id: Id7fcc82a28359e85feac57f9469f2bcd9192ee50
Closes-Bug: #1348262

Sync 838a2a3 oslo-incubator to get the new request_id shim, so
can introduce a deprecation warning that tells operators upgrading
from Juno that their paste.ini files need to point to oslo.middleware

This also syncs all other modules, except policy, which looks like it
needs some changes to heat thus will be handled via another patch.

Note we shouldn't remove this request_id shim until after Kilo is

Change-Id: I35125ffa263b0522ff6dd0b80b0beb3cbc79999b
Related-Bug: #1380629

commit_message:
sync oslo-incubator for request_id shim

Sync 838a2a3 oslo-incubator to get the new request_id shim, so
can introduce a deprecation warning that tells operators upgrading
from Juno that their paste.ini files need to point to oslo.middleware

This also syncs all other modules, except policy, which looks like it
needs some changes to heat thus will be handled via another patch.

Note we shouldn't remove this request_id shim until after Kilo is
branched.

Change-Id: I35125ffa263b0522ff6dd0b80b0beb3cbc79999b
Related-Bug: #1380629

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-23 18:43:20.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'Move to download.fedoraproject.org

download.fedoraproject.org is the mirror system, while
dl.fedoraproject.org is just one system. We have seen performance issues
with dl.fedoraproject.org and using download.fedoraproject.org was a
recommended as a solution by the folks at #fedora-admin.

Local testing on a rackspace server with dl.fedoraproject.org got about
70K/s while download.fedoraproject.org got over 1M/s

Move over to https as well.

Related-Bug: #1383928
Change-Id: I318d8844cfcfbc42c1e552e443c6b793d20f321f
'}]
commit_message:
Move to download.fedoraproject.org

download.fedoraproject.org is the mirror system, while
dl.fedoraproject.org is just one system. We have seen performance issues
with dl.fedoraproject.org and using download.fedoraproject.org was a
recommended as a solution by the folks at #fedora-admin.

Local testing on a rackspace server with dl.fedoraproject.org got about
70K/s while download.fedoraproject.org got over 1M/s

Move over to https as well.

Related-Bug: #1383928
Change-Id: I318d8844cfcfbc42c1e552e443c6b793d20f321f

subject: Add selection of Django session engine to this module
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-23 19:24:14.000000000', 'files': ['templates/local_settings.py.erb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/horizon_init_spec.rb'], 'message': "Add selection of Django session engine to this module

This allows Django to be set to use something other than
the default session engine through Puppet. By default,
it will have no impact on existing configurations.

We've added this because our security constraints make signed cookies
as a session store for Horizon undesirable. The reasons for this are:

  * Sessions become vulnerable to replay attacks,
    a clean log-out is difficult to achieve.
  * Serializing sessions in cookies may allow an attacker
    to escalate read-only access to server configuration
    into code execution via deserialization of attacker-generated
    content.

Change-Id: Iaf80bdc1bb9ce55ff46b2dcfac73daad90fd0d37
"}]
commit_message:
Add selection of Django session engine to this module

This allows Django to be set to use something other than
the default session engine through Puppet. By default,
it will have no impact on existing configurations.

We've added this because our security constraints make signed cookies
as a session store for Horizon undesirable. The reasons for this are:

  * Sessions become vulnerable to replay attacks,
    a clean log-out is difficult to achieve.
  * Serializing sessions in cookies may allow an attacker
    to escalate read-only access to server configuration
    into code execution via deserialization of attacker-generated
    content.

Change-Id: Iaf80bdc1bb9ce55ff46b2dcfac73daad90fd0d37

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-16 11:21:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/read_write_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_read_write_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmware_images.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/io_util.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmware_images.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Speed up transfer of images

The current implementation of the image transfer from Glance to
vCenter server is not as fast as it should be.
It is almost two times slower than "glance image-download | curl PUT".
The extra overhead comes from the copies of the bits from the
reading-thread to the queue and from the queue to the writing-thread.

This patch addresses the issue by removing the queue which doesn't
seem to have a valid reason to be there.

Fetch image (from Glance to VC):
1.5GB file: before 4m08s - now 2m30s

Snapshot (from VC to Glance):
1GB file: before: 3m56s - now 1m30s

Change-Id: Ifa2bdcc84d9e4d8668a9a346d9e050f2ac584048
Closes-Bug: #1278690
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Speed up transfer of images

The current implementation of the image transfer from Glance to
vCenter server is not as fast as it should be.
It is almost two times slower than "glance image-download | curl PUT".
The extra overhead comes from the copies of the bits from the
reading-thread to the queue and from the queue to the writing-thread.

This patch addresses the issue by removing the queue which doesn't
seem to have a valid reason to be there.

Fetch image (from Glance to VC):
1.5GB file: before 4m08s - now 2m30s

Snapshot (from VC to Glance):
1GB file: before: 3m56s - now 1m30s

Change-Id: Ifa2bdcc84d9e4d8668a9a346d9e050f2ac584048
Closes-Bug: #1278690

commit_message:
Storage planning info

Moved info from ref-arch to planning guide
- renamed file to 0100-storage-for images
  & subject to "Storage for Images"
- restructured information to read like planning issues
- removed list of Ceph limitations fixed in MOSt but not vanilla
  OpenStack -- they are moved to the ref-arch Ceph section
- now includes ephemeral as well as persistent storage;
  not a lot to say about ephemeral

terminology:  add ephemeral storage, lvm, persistent storage

user-guide:
- fix xref to planning material in configure/3500-cinder-glance-backend
- add tag to NTP section in initialize/400-pxe
- add config/settings/qcow to show the choice between qcow and raw
- added note to Settings/storage about selecting ephemeral storage

Closes-Bug: 1375823

Change-Id: I264e5c5fedac696e92d027b5e500b21dd74fb47e

commit_message:
Add [ssl] and 2 cinder attributes to nova.conf

This commit adds [ssl] section to nova.conf, which is used
to communicate with Glance when using https. It also adds
cinder_ca_certificates_file and cinder_api_insecure which are
needed for communicating with Cinder.

commit_message:
Add support for vhd vmdk vdi iso raw disk formats

Image upload provider already has a image type, but was not
used to handle the other common image types that have a simple
bare container format.   Expanded the list of types and allowed
the existing upload_image recipe to also take advantage of this
new provider disk type support in an optional way.  Backward
compatible.

Change-Id: I1f5983150aa648837c9bcd256f0ceb4bf73d4b52
Closes-Bug: #1383079

commit_message:

This patch extends some of the docstrings in the `Client` class with
more useful information. The patch also adds `intersphinx` to allow for
linking to other docs within zaqarclient. For example:

will link to the documentation for Transport if it has been generated.

commit_message:
Support building wheels (PEP-427)

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: Ied9e2aa765fe006d66df7f431462252204dc5baa

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-23 19:39:25.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/tests/unit/plugins/mapr/versions/test_base_cluster_configurer.py'], 'message': 'Remove explicit set of CONF.os_region_name in mapr plugin tests

The explicit set of os_region_name to None breaks subsequent
unit tests running in the same worker process that attempt to
override os_region_name.  Any setting of os_region_name in unit
tests should use the set_override or set_default methods available
in oslo.config.

Close-bug: 1384875
Change-Id: Iea2eb58dc3d8e8667795495c6cc1f68538d524b6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove explicit set of CONF.os_region_name in mapr plugin tests

The explicit set of os_region_name to None breaks subsequent
unit tests running in the same worker process that attempt to
override os_region_name.  Any setting of os_region_name in unit
tests should use the set_override or set_default methods available
in oslo.config.

Close-bug: 1384875
Change-Id: Iea2eb58dc3d8e8667795495c6cc1f68538d524b6

subject: Mask keystone token in debug output
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-10-10 20:18:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/apiclient/client.py', 'tests/unit/apiclient/test_client.py'], 'message': "Mask keystone token in debug output

replaying the keystone token in debug output is both completely
burdensome to read (given it's unbounded size), but it's also
potentially a security issue given that it could be used in replay
attacks.
Instead, filter the headers to sha1 sensitive things, with X-Auth-Token
being the only one listed so far. The sha1 will at least give us the
understanding of tokens being the same or different (and an administrator
could use that to figure out if they were valid later).
This also removes some extra '\n' that were being injected into the
debug logs, because they were not helping with readability.
Lastly, actually test logging. This introduces the first tests of the
logging path using the logging fixture. It's pretty basic, but does
verify that requests are logged at debug, that the SHA1 format works,
and that headers which are not listed get shown straight through.
DocImpact because this changes the curl dumped strings which people
may have been using. They can still do that as long as they generate
their own keystone token.

Ported from original change id:
I1edb94785705c3b6a05f118b77d3aeb07461cd44

Change-Id: Ie074e44bffac5e0f35d2162570fdba233b27dd0a
"}]
commit_message:
Mask keystone token in debug output

replaying the keystone token in debug output is both completely
burdensome to read (given it's unbounded size), but it's also
potentially a security issue given that it could be used in replay
attacks.
Instead, filter the headers to sha1 sensitive things, with X-Auth-Token
being the only one listed so far. The sha1 will at least give us the
understanding of tokens being the same or different (and an administrator
could use that to figure out if they were valid later).
This also removes some extra '\n' that were being injected into the
debug logs, because they were not helping with readability.
Lastly, actually test logging. This introduces the first tests of the
logging path using the logging fixture. It's pretty basic, but does
verify that requests are logged at debug, that the SHA1 format works,
and that headers which are not listed get shown straight through.
DocImpact because this changes the curl dumped strings which people
may have been using. They can still do that as long as they generate
their own keystone token.

Ported from original change id:
I1edb94785705c3b6a05f118b77d3aeb07461cd44

Change-Id: Ie074e44bffac5e0f35d2162570fdba233b27dd0a

added until python 2.7.9 so TLSv1 is the only compatible option

Change-Id: I68bd72fc4d90a102003d9ce48c47a4a6a3dd6e03
"}]
commit_message:
Big Switch: Switch to TLSv1 in server manager

Switch to TLSv1 for the connections to the backend
controllers. The default SSLv3 is no longer considered
secure.

TLSv1 was chosen over .1 or .2 because the .1 and .2 weren't
added until python 2.7.9 so TLSv1 is the only compatible option
for py26.

Closes-Bug: #1384487
Change-Id: I68bd72fc4d90a102003d9ce48c47a4a6a3dd6e03

subject: Repair tox -ecover
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-23 14:01:24.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Repair tox -ecover

Some tests are ignored during the invocation of 'tox -epy27' and
similar, but they were not ignored during the 'cover' profile. Becuase
the ignored tests actually fail when run this means that 'tox -ecover'
could not be used.

This patch just ignores the same tests in the 'cover' profile as the
default.

Change-Id: I7952c312addfed87f6055c1a360adfbf1fd5b168
"}]
commit_message:
Repair tox -ecover

Some tests are ignored during the invocation of 'tox -epy27' and
similar, but they were not ignored during the 'cover' profile. Becuase
the ignored tests actually fail when run this means that 'tox -ecover'
could not be used.

This patch just ignores the same tests in the 'cover' profile as the
default.

commit_message:
Move to download.fedoraproject.org

download.fedoraproject.org is the mirror system, while
dl.fedoraproject.org is just one system. We have seen performance issues
with dl.fedoraproject.org and using download.fedoraproject.org was a
recommended as a solution by the folks at #fedora-admin.

Local testing on a rackspace server with dl.fedoraproject.org got about
70K/s while download.fedoraproject.org got over 1M/s

Move over to https as well.

Related-Bug: #1383928
Change-Id: I318d8844cfcfbc42c1e552e443c6b793d20f321f
(cherry picked from commit cac1317676dcb0efa489dd667793cf4f6b366170)

subject: Remove icehouse heat slow job from tempest check
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-23 20:08:10.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Remove icehouse heat slow job from tempest check

This commit removes the stable heat slow job from the tempest check
queue. This jobs were added originally to ensure branchless tempest
continued to work against the stable branches in all gating configs.
But, because of some heat bugs and changes in testing methodology this
job doesn't add much value for icehouse. That coupled with the recent
nodepool image cache issues we've been hitting it makes more sense to
just remove the job. If the value of the job is increased and after
nodepool issues are sorted we can add this back.

Change-Id: I88b61b6aa70a1e336aeff66560134d7444f91880
"}]
commit_message:
Remove icehouse heat slow job from tempest check

This commit removes the stable heat slow job from the tempest check
queue. This jobs were added originally to ensure branchless tempest
continued to work against the stable branches in all gating configs.
But, because of some heat bugs and changes in testing methodology this
job doesn't add much value for icehouse. That coupled with the recent
nodepool image cache issues we've been hitting it makes more sense to
just remove the job. If the value of the job is increased and after
nodepool issues are sorted we can add this back.

Change-Id: I88b61b6aa70a1e336aeff66560134d7444f91880

commit_message:
Ensure ofagent unit tests handles random hashseeds

Several tests in test_ofa_neutron_agent.py and test_ofa_flows.py fail when
running the unit tests with hashseed 2701526934.

This patch fixes the failing unit tests by specifying that assert_has_calls does
not need to assert any order.

Change-Id: I48d6601130f7de1f6eeb7333a17eddd82e7acbdf
Partial-Bug: 1348818

commit_message:
Move to download.fedoraproject.org

download.fedoraproject.org is the mirror system, while
dl.fedoraproject.org is just one system. We have seen performance issues
with dl.fedoraproject.org and using download.fedoraproject.org was a
recommended as a solution by the folks at #fedora-admin.
Local testing on a rackspace server with dl.fedoraproject.org got about
70K/s while download.fedoraproject.org got over 1M/s

Note this is not a cherry-pick of I318d8844cfcfbc42c1e552e443c6b793d20f321f, because that wouldn't work

Change-Id: Ic68efcef0ed62f7867114d6992aee1610d6e8eb9
Related-Bug: #1383928

commit_message:
VMware: Restore datastore refactoring changes

A previous commit 9adba6727bbec051c1437ee95367ecb97b207f35 was
reverted because the driver reported aggregate disk stats.

This patch restores partial changes that refactored datastore
utility methods in that commit.

commit_message:
Removed already configured steps in Debian

Many of the configuration directives which have to be manually
changed to follow the install-guide have been made the default
in Debian, therefore, it is preferable to simply remove them
from the install-guide, to make it easier for the end user.

Change-Id: Ib5babda7601e040f4b544e3b01e08b5b7f02cbc3

subject: Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-10-22 13:55:13.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.json', 'Modulefile'], 'message': 'Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno), and deps.
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.

Change-Id: I6aae75b5c2128f80e880bb4934811931db32eb59
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno), and deps.
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.

Change-Id: I6aae75b5c2128f80e880bb4934811931db32eb59

 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.

subject: Switch to Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-22 22:07:27.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'Switch to Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda

The heat-slow job using the Fedora-20 image as L2 guest, the
currently used version is affected by the heartbleed issue and
the Mb-Bios bug issue observed with emulation.

This version of the  Fedora cloud image uses the no_timer_check
kernel parameter, which solves the MP-Bios Bug issue.

The Image tested with ~3000 heat-slow job, without any issue.

Closes-Bug: #1312199
Closes-Bug: #1297560
(cherry picked from commit bfcb2ff732ffdf2ed50be6a677f1b6182a0213a4)

Conflicts:
	stackrc

Closes-Bug: #1383928

Change-Id: I9ce9b7769c2d91e630b0362f2c2c6ac9066defbc
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda

The heat-slow job using the Fedora-20 image as L2 guest, the
currently used version is affected by the heartbleed issue and
the Mb-Bios bug issue observed with emulation.

This version of the  Fedora cloud image uses the no_timer_check
kernel parameter, which solves the MP-Bios Bug issue.

The Image tested with ~3000 heat-slow job, without any issue.

Closes-Bug: #1312199
Closes-Bug: #1297560
(cherry picked from commit bfcb2ff732ffdf2ed50be6a677f1b6182a0213a4)

Conflicts:
	stackrc

Closes-Bug: #1383928

Change-Id: I9ce9b7769c2d91e630b0362f2c2c6ac9066defbc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-10 19:46:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Keep migration status if instance still resizing

There is a race condition during finish_resize() where
poll_unconfirmed_resizes() can get called between the database save
of the migration record and instance record. The migration record
will be marked 'finished', enabling poll_unconfirmed_resizes() to pick
it up. But the instance will not have been saved yet to have the
vm_state of RESIZED, and task_state of None. The task_state will
still be RESIZE_FINISH. This will cause poll_unconfirmed_resizes() to
put the migration record in error state.

Instead, poll_unconfirmed_resizes() should ignore instances with
a task state of RESIZE_FINISH and not put the migration record
into error state.

Change-Id: I825234de5e4a4f0cc906ac05b715ed85cd953aa1
Closes-Bug: #1376933
"}]
commit_message:
Keep migration status if instance still resizing

There is a race condition during finish_resize() where
poll_unconfirmed_resizes() can get called between the database save
of the migration record and instance record. The migration record
will be marked 'finished', enabling poll_unconfirmed_resizes() to pick
it up. But the instance will not have been saved yet to have the
vm_state of RESIZED, and task_state of None. The task_state will
still be RESIZE_FINISH. This will cause poll_unconfirmed_resizes() to
put the migration record in error state.

Instead, poll_unconfirmed_resizes() should ignore instances with
a task state of RESIZE_FINISH and not put the migration record
into error state.

Change-Id: I825234de5e4a4f0cc906ac05b715ed85cd953aa1
Closes-Bug: #1376933

commit_message:
Installed builtin reordering everywhere

Installed the builtin reordering code into NonrecursiveRuleTheory
and MaterializedViewTheory.  Added tests for MaterializedViewTheory.
Also tweaked the builtin interface and simplified how other modules
utilize that interface.

Closes-bug: 1350074
Closes-bug: 1350077
Change-Id: I30ec45917686225c43204eafa9364a64ecae3dd7

subject: Added builtin safety and reordering to policy engine
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-10-22 23:40:59.000000000', 'files': ['congress/policy/builtin/tests/test_builtin.py', 'congress/policy/compile.py', 'congress/policy/runtime.py'], 'message': 'Added builtin safety and reordering to policy engine

Previously, policy writers needed to ensure that left-to-right evaluation
of the rule body guaranteed that all the inputs for a builtin were bound
before that builtin was evaluated.  Similarly for negation.

This change automates the reordering process, but does so in a way
that leaves the rule unchanged if it is properly ordered.  This ensures
that people can hand-tweak the ordering if they want, but they do
not need to.  It constitutes a first step toward query optimization.

Change-Id: Ia8e522dcec655df6c49a71f748f6280b9df64eeb
'}]
commit_message:
Added builtin safety and reordering to policy engine

Previously, policy writers needed to ensure that left-to-right evaluation
of the rule body guaranteed that all the inputs for a builtin were bound
before that builtin was evaluated.  Similarly for negation.

This change automates the reordering process, but does so in a way
that leaves the rule unchanged if it is properly ordered.  This ensures
that people can hand-tweak the ordering if they want, but they do
not need to.  It constitutes a first step toward query optimization.

Change-Id: Ia8e522dcec655df6c49a71f748f6280b9df64eeb

commit_message:
Throw HTTP 409 (Conflict) on duplicate rules

Previously, we just returned the ID of the original rule.

We decided it was better to throw a 409.

Change-Id: I641481edf4f55299895b33ef0a0c13cf574d49c0

commit_message:
Added status for datasources and exposed status via API

This change adds get_status() for every datasource and
exposes that information through the API.  Right now,
the status of a datasource consists of (i) the time
the service was last updated and (ii) the last
error that occurred.

Implements: dse-dataservices-status
Change-Id: I75271dc82c7889061f9d125d9205134a0daea817

Borrowed (with license) from python-dateutil.  We're copying
code here instead of inserting it as a package.  Because
(1) this package is not supported by OS.
(2) all new OS packages must be python 3 compliant.
(3) this package has a python-3 compliant version and a python-2 version
(4) Congress is not yet python-3 compliant

Change-Id: Idaa29ecd9fc6d12298ca441748f71b6e41262d8f

commit_message:
Add dateutil code

Borrowed (with license) from python-dateutil.  We're copying
code here instead of inserting it as a package.  Because
(1) this package is not supported by OS.
(2) all new OS packages must be python 3 compliant.
(3) this package has a python-3 compliant version and a python-2 version
(4) Congress is not yet python-3 compliant

Change-Id: Idaa29ecd9fc6d12298ca441748f71b6e41262d8f

Don't double log API request

If debug logging is enabled the full API call, request and response is
logged, so don't log the request twice.

HTTP requests from Sahara to Hadoop services can wait indefinitely when

commit_message:
Flush netcat socket buffer when proxying HTTP connections

HTTP requests from Sahara to Hadoop services can wait indefinitely when
proxied through Neutron namespaces, because buffers are not flushed.
Make sure they are to avoid deadlocks.

Change-Id: Ic1d1b74345be49e405f00264b8c7df3dc06c5b09
Closes-bug: #1384316

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-21 15:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/utils/openstack/neutron.py'], 'message': 'Fix argument list in NeutronClientRemoteWrapper

When trying to get a cached NeutronHttpAdapter object, use:
  self.adapters.get((host, port), None)
instead of:
  self.adapters.get((host, port), None, *args, **kwargs)
since self.adapters is a dictionary.  Pass *args and **kwargs to the
NeutronHttpAdapter constructor.

Change-Id: I0075fa9c59d43b5382606fa166bdb297e25fed2e
Closes-Bug: #1383764
'}]
commit_message:
Fix argument list in NeutronClientRemoteWrapper

When trying to get a cached NeutronHttpAdapter object, use:
  self.adapters.get((host, port), None)
instead of:
  self.adapters.get((host, port), None, *args, **kwargs)
since self.adapters is a dictionary.  Pass *args and **kwargs to the
NeutronHttpAdapter constructor.

Change-Id: I0075fa9c59d43b5382606fa166bdb297e25fed2e
Closes-Bug: #1383764

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-22 15:33:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/connection.rst', 'openstack/connection.py'], 'message': "Move the examples docs into the code

I like the idea of having the examples in the code.  I don't necessarily
like having to scroll through all those comments to get to the code.  This
also changes the order of the documentation to summary, example, reference
versus summary, reference, example.  I think I'm okay with that because
:class links will anchor to the reference section.  Normally, seeing a
simple example first can be more useful.

This is a response to Doug's comment:

Change-Id: Ibbda909d2183edc6baeeec0bc56f01779334aabd

commit_message:
Move the examples docs into the code

I like the idea of having the examples in the code.  I don't necessarily
like having to scroll through all those comments to get to the code.  This
also changes the order of the documentation to summary, example, reference
versus summary, reference, example.  I think I'm okay with that because
:class links will anchor to the reference section.  Normally, seeing a
simple example first can be more useful.

This is a response to Doug's comment:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/129937/1/doc/source/user_preference.rst

Change-Id: Ibbda909d2183edc6baeeec0bc56f01779334aabd

commit_message:
Implemented plugin creation and building in fpb

* `fpb --create plugin_name` creates a plugin structure
* `fpb --build plugin_path` builds repository, and
  packs plugin as tar.gz
* add run_tests.sh which runs pep8 checks and unit
  tests for fpb

Change-Id: Id4d108b7427869a5dc0200158d3e2c93c59a33ca
Implements: blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

commit_message:
Add sorting for releases collection

  Implement sorting for ReleaseCollection in /api/releases
  Sorting criteria:
  1) Fuel version
  2) OpenStack release
  3) Operating system. Ubuntu is preferred

Closes-Bug: 1377920

subject: Add ability to deal with migrated volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-22 19:02:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "Add ability to deal with migrated volumes

The general migration impl in Cinder works
by creating a new volume, transfering the data
from the original volume to the new volume, and
then deleting the original and flipping the ID
of the new volume.

This requires some work on the backend device to
update it's ID/Name so it knows how to find the
requested volume after a migration.

Currently the SF driver would just look for the
volume, however the only volume it would have available
is the newly created volume which has a different UUID.

This patch utilizes the newly added update_migrated_volume
call to verify things after a migration.

The real fix however is that on a volume-create we check to
see if this creation is part of a migration operation, if it
is we need to set Fake out the Volume-Name ahead of time
because we can't change it after the fact without jumping through
a boat load of hoops.  This works well in our case because we
allow duplicate names.

Change-Id: Icf4b2d17dea5642afa308b2b99ad0cc4fc317c80
Closes-Bug: #1381943
"}]
commit_message:
Add ability to deal with migrated volumes

The general migration impl in Cinder works
by creating a new volume, transfering the data
from the original volume to the new volume, and
then deleting the original and flipping the ID
of the new volume.

This requires some work on the backend device to
update it's ID/Name so it knows how to find the
requested volume after a migration.

Currently the SF driver would just look for the
volume, however the only volume it would have available
is the newly created volume which has a different UUID.

This patch utilizes the newly added update_migrated_volume
call to verify things after a migration.

The real fix however is that on a volume-create we check to
see if this creation is part of a migration operation, if it
is we need to set Fake out the Volume-Name ahead of time
because we can't change it after the fact without jumping through
a boat load of hoops.  This works well in our case because we
allow duplicate names.

Change-Id: Icf4b2d17dea5642afa308b2b99ad0cc4fc317c80
Closes-Bug: #1381943

tested by ZUUL).

commit_message:
Build a local pip mirror of python packages being tested

Build a pypi mirror in ~/.cache/image-create/pypi/mirror/ , exposing
this over http allows us to use this as the main pip index where ci
built trunk packages can be installed from (for the projects being
tested by ZUUL).

Co-Authored-By: Gregory Haynes <greg@greghaynes.net>
Change-Id: I33d2b6fbfadb259861a6d961ceac5c0e97de2904

commit_message:
Neutron HA composition model

* Refactor part of the corosync/pacemaker resources to be outside of the neutron module
* Adaption cluster::corosync::cs_service to asymetric cluster

This allows for seperate management of the HA scripts and classes from the
neutron module and will allow the module to continue to track upstream with
out modifiation in regards to HA support

Authors: Andrew Woodward, Sergey Vasilenko

partial blueprint: merge-openstack-puppet-modules
blueprint: ml2-neutron

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: If471a371c11a26f5b4182bc3afcf391d00012666

commit_message:
Adapt upstream puppet-neutron into fuel

Fix up new entry points
Refactor openstack:: to enter neutron instead of old sanitize_network
Plug in new neutron HA composition
Add in some changes that need to make it back into upstream eventually.

Authors: Andrew Woodward, Bogdan Dobrelya, Sergey Vasilenko

partial-blueprint: merge-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: I4af4b70173007e3d780ca4fcde3d6ae30d5d9666

subject: Raise the new OperationTimedOut when futures don't finish
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-08 00:44:09.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/memcached.py'], 'message': "Raise the new OperationTimedOut when futures don't finish

When a future hasn't finished in time it will raise a
specific exception that we should reraise as the new wrapped
error so that users of tooz can nicely handle time outs in
a uniform manner.

Change-Id: Id0b0965e5dcd66e0338fd57294236a14aff4b3d1
"}]
commit_message:
Raise the new OperationTimedOut when futures don't finish

When a future hasn't finished in time it will raise a
specific exception that we should reraise as the new wrapped
error so that users of tooz can nicely handle time outs in
a uniform manner.

Change-Id: Id0b0965e5dcd66e0338fd57294236a14aff4b3d1

subject: Add a temp workaround for an issue #153 in rabbit cookbook
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2589, 'name': 'Salman Baset', 'email': 'sabaset@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'salman-h'}, {'_account_id': 7128, 'name': 'Mark Vanderwiel', 'email': 'vanderwl@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kramvan'}, {'_account_id': 7769, 'name': 'Pentheus', 'display_name': 'Alan Meadows', 'email': 'alan.meadows@gmail.com', 'username': 'alanmeadows'}, {'_account_id': 8112, 'name': 'Ma Wen Cheng', 'email': 'wenchma@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'wenchma'}, {'_account_id': 8172, 'name': 'Wei Hu', 'email': 'huwei.xtu@gmail.com', 'username': 'WeiHu'}, {'_account_id': 8410, 'name': 'Richard Theis', 'email': 'rtheis@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'rtheis'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-22 15:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/rabbitmq-server.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'spec/rabbitmq-server_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add a temp workaround for an issue #153 in rabbit cookbook

After configuring rabbitmq, restart the service to make configuration
take effect. So during OpenStack deployment, OpenStack services can
connect to rabbitmq successfully.
This workaround will notify rabbitmq-server to restart immediately.
This could be remove once the issue #153 is fixed in rabbit cookbook.

Change-Id: Ib017226f46c7e26429bb26df5b63525e1a98bc82
Closes-Bug: #1380940
'}]
commit_message:
Add a temp workaround for an issue #153 in rabbit cookbook

After configuring rabbitmq, restart the service to make configuration
take effect. So during OpenStack deployment, OpenStack services can
connect to rabbitmq successfully.
This workaround will notify rabbitmq-server to restart immediately.
This could be remove once the issue #153 is fixed in rabbit cookbook.

Change-Id: Ib017226f46c7e26429bb26df5b63525e1a98bc82
Closes-Bug: #1380940

commit_message:
Purge old neutron manifests and move our customized files

outside from community neutron manifest.

This makes it easier to carry rebases forward and prevent conflicts.
This may be squased into the merge from upstream commit.

Authors: Andrew Woodward, Sergey Vasilenko

blueprint: ml2-neutron

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I9b69c2ab4cb4e476083ec9516f442d9b1911b666

commit_message:
Start to add a catch and reraise of timed out exceptions

When the kazoo operation times out it will raise a kazoo handler
specific exception which we should ensure we catch and reraise
as a tooz specific one to make it easier for users of tooz to
catch and handle driver timeouts.

Change-Id: I9caa1e8e550e3cba04fc139ede897e2a7c511f79

commit_message:
Construct and pass action_context to action

If action_context is defined in the init method of an action, a
dictionary of execution and task information is constructed and passed
as input parameters to the init method.

Change-Id: I25627a0bc94c5b55a33b71602f44d7297e2a0c10
Closes-Bug: 1380873

subject: Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-10-22 13:55:45.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.json', 'Modulefile'], 'message': 'Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno), and deps.
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.

Change-Id: I7056bb05a33ce24f1f0b0b363de0f848e49eb299
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno), and deps.
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.

Change-Id: I7056bb05a33ce24f1f0b0b363de0f848e49eb299

commit_message:
Horizon integration tests require Xvfb

Xvfb isn't installed by default on devstack nodes. Since it's a
requirement for the Horizon integration tests, create a new macro to
install it only for the jobs where it is needed.

Change-Id: I168fe5f1e6253ded89728ee2a69f8cf3197d2000

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-21 00:49:09.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_group.py'], 'message': 'Make sure that AutoScalingGroup depends on the launch config

It seems to be common error to do the following:
  LaunchConfigurationName: my_config
and not include a depends_on.

Largely because of the unfortunate property name.
So this patch tries to make sure the user has the

commit_message:
Make sure that AutoScalingGroup depends on the launch config

It seems to be common error to do the following:
  LaunchConfigurationName: my_config
and not include a depends_on.

Largely because of the unfortunate property name.
So this patch tries to make sure the user has the
correct dependency in place.

Change-Id: I4f7d282d0af8681dc2c8cd265e16a27fe23a3bdb
Closes-bug: #1375777

subject: apt-ftparchive*.conf: don't hard code Ubuntu version
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-10-21 10:41:17.000000000', 'files': ['mirror/ubuntu/files/apt-ftparchive-udeb.conf', 'mirror/ubuntu/files/Release-amd64', 'config.mk', 'mirror/ubuntu/createchroot.mk', 'mirror/ubuntu/files/apt-ftparchive-deb.conf', 'mirror/ubuntu/files/apt-ftparchive-release.conf'], 'message': "apt-ftparchive*.conf: don't hard code Ubuntu version

Use the UBUNTU_RELEASE and (the newly introduced) UBUNTU_RELEASE_NUMBER
variables instead.

The idea is to have a single place (config.mk) where the Ubuntu (kernel,
whatever) versions are defined (instead of spreading that data over 10+ files)

Change-Id: If6b298aa51cdffde6c633c3b7128173148fe95aa
Related-bug: #1383641
"}]
commit_message:
apt-ftparchive*.conf: don't hard code Ubuntu version

Use the UBUNTU_RELEASE and (the newly introduced) UBUNTU_RELEASE_NUMBER
variables instead.

The idea is to have a single place (config.mk) where the Ubuntu (kernel,
whatever) versions are defined (instead of spreading that data over 10+ files)

Change-Id: If6b298aa51cdffde6c633c3b7128173148fe95aa
Related-bug: #1383641

Related-bug: #1383641
"}]
commit_message:
requirements-deb.txt: omit redundant packages

 * don't list packages pulled by ubuntu-minimal/ubuntu-standard metapackages
 * don't list the dependencies of build-essential metapackage
 * don't list nova, neutron, cinder, and glance dependencies

Skip the prerequisites of the following packages:

 * apache2
 * aptitude
 * cloud-init
 * corosync
 * cpu-checker
 * crda
 * discover
 * gdisk
 * git
 * grub-pc
 * guestmount
 * libgtk2.0 (not sure why we need libgtk itself)
 * libparse-debianchangelog-perl
 * libvte9 (why do we need this one?)
 * lksctp-tools
 * mysql
 * nodejs
 * novnc
 * pacemaker
 * python-utidylib
 * python-zmq
 * qemu-kvm
 * ruby-ohai
 * rabbitmq-server
 * tasksel
 * xauth
 * xinetd

Also added a script which helps to reduce dependencies.

Note: the obtained requirements-deb.txt still contains redundant and
extraneous entries, this issue will be handled later on.

Change-Id: Ic0d143a6f6e2eae01b721bae4fd3b6b748558c3b
Related-bug: #1383641

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-10 14:17:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_block_device.py', 'nova/block_device.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Prepend '/dev/' to supplied dev names in the API

Make sure that all user input device names end up in the database with
the '/dev/' prefix. This will make things more consistent and avoid
issues when attempting to parse device names.

This includes two main sources - block device mapping that can be passed
as part of a request or as image metadata, and root device name, passed
as image metadata.

Closes-bug: #1337821
Change-Id: Ibda82f511be99f1a68f2f77c72601a1b006be7a0
"}]
commit_message:
Prepend '/dev/' to supplied dev names in the API

Make sure that all user input device names end up in the database with
the '/dev/' prefix. This will make things more consistent and avoid
issues when attempting to parse device names.

This includes two main sources - block device mapping that can be passed
as part of a request or as image metadata, and root device name, passed
as image metadata.

Closes-bug: #1337821
Change-Id: Ibda82f511be99f1a68f2f77c72601a1b006be7a0

ignore list (Ifc8924914b5a0d625bc8df6442ee85eb21459cde)

Then I4cf246e3ec932ba0d2391eb8bcb793b28b005b4c came along and updated
the list to break out the E12 ignored on purpose list.

Drop all E12 rules from the ignored on purpose list, as we do not want
to ignore these on purpose.

Change-Id: Ic400047347a82aebbc0f6ce6f5061e7757a02d3d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove E12* from list of deliberately ignored flake8 rules

I367064ecaa6d1fd9d918f7ce003303e2db660647  Added E12 to the
ignored on purpose list, which also makes no sense E12 was never meant
to be skipped all together (I was the one who added E12 to the flake8
ignore list (Ifc8924914b5a0d625bc8df6442ee85eb21459cde)

Then I4cf246e3ec932ba0d2391eb8bcb793b28b005b4c came along and updated
the list to break out the E12 ignored on purpose list.

Drop all E12 rules from the ignored on purpose list, as we do not want
to ignore these on purpose.

Change-Id: Ic400047347a82aebbc0f6ce6f5061e7757a02d3d

subject: Add instance ID validation stage while creating incremental backup
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5390, 'name': 'Steve Leon', 'username': 'steve-leon', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8415, 'name': 'Denis M.', 'email': 'lildee1991@gmail.com', 'username': 'dmakogon'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 10295, 'name': 'mariam john', 'email': 'mariamj@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'mariamj'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2014-09-22 12:36:12.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/exception.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/backup/test_backup_models.py', 'trove/common/wsgi.py', 'trove/backup/models.py', 'trove/tests/api/backups.py'], 'message': 'Add instance ID validation stage while creating incremental backup

Reasons:
 - user is able to create incremental backup
   using parent backup taken from another instance.

Changes:
 - adding instance validation stage while
   attempting to create incremental backup;
 - unit/int tests proposed.

Behaviour:
 - when attempting to create incremental backup by using
   parent from different instance server side
   will raise ParentBackupIDMismatch exception;
 - from user perspective exception will be interpreted
   as HTTP Forbidden(403) according to RFC 2616 -- Trove server site
   understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill
   it due to IDs mismatch.

Change-Id: Ia9a1efca03bd52461273298bac332ec897102aea
Closes-Bug: #1344133
'}]
commit_message:
Add instance ID validation stage while creating incremental backup

Reasons:
 - user is able to create incremental backup
   using parent backup taken from another instance.

Changes:
 - adding instance validation stage while
   attempting to create incremental backup;
 - unit/int tests proposed.

Behaviour:
 - when attempting to create incremental backup by using
   parent from different instance server side
   will raise ParentBackupIDMismatch exception;
 - from user perspective exception will be interpreted
   as HTTP Forbidden(403) according to RFC 2616 -- Trove server site
   understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill
   it due to IDs mismatch.

Change-Id: Ia9a1efca03bd52461273298bac332ec897102aea
Closes-Bug: #1344133

commit_message:
Fix incremental backups feature validation

Reasons:
 - Not all strategies have incremental backup strategy.
   Existing example: MySQLDump.
   Future: CbBackup, MongoDump, NodetoolSnapshot.

Changes:
 - incremental backups feature validation stage added;
 - adding fix to fake guest;
 - unit/fake-int tests proposed.

Behaviour:
 - server side will raise IncrementalBackupNotSupported;
 - from client perspective this error will interpreted
   as HTTP NotImplemented(501).

Change-Id: I025cf24f776bbff934a7522b9fa1e68e48f42c38
Closes-Bug: #1340175

commit_message:
Virt driver pinning guest vCPUs to host pCPUs

This feature aims to improve the libvirt driver so that it is
able to strictly pin guest vCPUS to host pCPUs. This provides
the concept of "dedicated CPU" guest instances.

Change-Id: I29e2f3cbf45ae36c6c6b7a089d46cc6710bfbbe0

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-10-16 17:04:17.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Update multiple backend configuration in tempest script

Currently when we configure the tempest with multiple LVM
backends the backend names are created as LVM_iSCSI and
LVM_iSCSI_2 which fails since the backends created by cinder
are lvmdriver-1 and lvmdriver-2.

This patch updates the backend names. Added support for
CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS and added todo to remove
CINDER_MULTI_LVM_BACKEND once its formally removed

Closes-Bug:#1369946
Closes-Bug:#1369942

Change-Id: If44f5eb206616afb0fbaf333f3fa6a296d4650cd
'}]
commit_message:
Update multiple backend configuration in tempest script

Currently when we configure the tempest with multiple LVM
backends the backend names are created as LVM_iSCSI and
LVM_iSCSI_2 which fails since the backends created by cinder
are lvmdriver-1 and lvmdriver-2.

This patch updates the backend names. Added support for
CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS and added todo to remove
CINDER_MULTI_LVM_BACKEND once its formally removed

Closes-Bug:#1369946
Closes-Bug:#1369942

Change-Id: If44f5eb206616afb0fbaf333f3fa6a296d4650cd

commit_message:
Adds tty password entry for ironicclient

Added functionality from keystoneclient to fallback to the tty for password
entry if no password is given via the environment or the --os-password option.

Change-Id: I92da7112221c77efc220374617d503dc2184363e
Closes-Bug: 1382146

commit_message:
Add missing parameters for server rescue

The server rescue call supports passing a password and an image,
however novaclient does not have options to support this. This commit
adds these options and updates the related unit tests to support the
change.

Change-Id: I14c878c0027f8206671ee001ba5195f94f842314

commit_message:
Console: delete code for VMRCConsole and VMRCSessionConsole

In Juno there was warning that this code will be removed in Kilo.
This patch deletes the VMRC console classes for the ESX and VC drivers.
This code has not worked since the Icehouse release.

Change-Id: If2d1e237f92eb080dadc2eee1f2f2771a06ce2f6

commit_message:
no way to delete valid/invalid security rule

Previously deleting valid/invalid security
group rules was throwing the error of
"AttributeError". With this fix, now both
types of security group rules can be deleted.

Change-Id: I253c2742efe69ee41976c88ca2775189bc5bde0d
Closes-Bug: #1163469

commit_message:
Use instance object in resource_tracker

The resource tracker is being converted to use objects. This patch
removes the conductor call to instance_update and replaces it with a
call to Instance#save.

Furthers bp make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I73fbfc951f9ac51e991f3884e85c67512359f9e3

commit_message:
VMware: rename vmware_images to images

There is no need for the prefix vmware. vmware_images.py has been
renamed to images.py and test_vmware_images.py has been renamed
to test_images.py.

Change-Id: Icbc64da072f60713c1a79aca2ed503dcd7586063

subject: remove reference to model in migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-21 20:43:58.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/014_add_event_message_id.py'], 'message': "remove reference to model in migration

the model represents the current active representation.
migrations on the other hand represent some moment in past that
may or may not reflect the current model. we shouldn't reference
model unless we have to.

Change-Id: I78dca9043014acc1a6eda479f687f63d31ce1ea7
"}]
commit_message:
remove reference to model in migration

the model represents the current active representation.
migrations on the other hand represent some moment in past that
may or may not reflect the current model. we shouldn't reference
model unless we have to.

Change-Id: I78dca9043014acc1a6eda479f687f63d31ce1ea7

commit_message:
Cisco VPNaaS and router integration

Spec for completion of the effort to integrate the Cisco VPNaaS
plugin with the L3 router plugin to use an in-band Cisco CSR
router.

Change-Id: I7d590c29c1815377f3b95f4574e38823bb1b6f18
Implements: blueprint cisco-vpnaas-and-router-integration

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-09-03 13:01:33.000000000', 'files': ['tests/sqlalchemy/test_utils.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py'], 'message': "Add create_database_permission_exist function

commit_message:
Add create_database_permission_exist function

If user doesn't have permission to create database we
get incomprehensible error message when run tests.
Additional check to test whether user has permission
was added to get clear message error.

Change-Id: I608e61d4832c2a8c72c835a084f39560b8fba867

subject: Implement db.ModelBase.iteritems() as a generator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-26 15:47:17.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Implement db.ModelBase.iteritems() as a generator

It is better to use generators if it is possible, because
we don't create extra arrays and we can improve perfomance

Closes-Bug: #1119727

Co-Authored-By: Boris Pavlovic <boris@pavlovic.me>

Change-Id: Ibbe734540aa6fd32c9f7dd4667e4d00b9465af6f
"}]
commit_message:
Implement db.ModelBase.iteritems() as a generator

It is better to use generators if it is possible, because
we don't create extra arrays and we can improve perfomance

Closes-Bug: #1119727

Co-Authored-By: Boris Pavlovic <boris@pavlovic.me>

Change-Id: Ibbe734540aa6fd32c9f7dd4667e4d00b9465af6f

commit_message:
Add functional API tests for cron-triggers

- Added API tests which check main api calls to cron-trigger endpoint
- Fixed tearDown method (there was a problem when item array
had a few elements, not all of them were deleted)

Partly implements: blueprint mistral-triggers-functional-tests

Change-Id: Ibba7cd03e6ccdf06c76ea4ea161542b954faee0f

commit_message:
Add CLI tests for triggers

- Added positive tests which check all CLI commands to work with triggers
- Added a few negative tests which check pattern validationx
and input parameters

Partly implements: mistral-triggers-functional-tests

Change-Id: I76dca4f7cae4b3de38f9ae76aa741184471d4f9f

commit_message:
Adapt upstream puppet-neutron into fuel

Fix up new entry points
Refactor openstack:: to enter neutron instead of old sanitize_network
Plug in new neutron HA composition
Add in some changes that need to make it back into upstream eventually.

blueprint: ml2-neutron
partial-blueprint: merge-openstack-puppet-modules

Conflicts resolved:
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/compute.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/controller_ha.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ha/neutron.pp
	deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/cluster_ha.pp
	deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/cluster_simple.pp

Change-Id: I4af4b70173007e3d780ca4fcde3d6ae30d5d9659

revisions:
[{'number': 42, 'created': '2014-10-23 08:13:37.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/neutron/l3.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/neutron/ovs.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/neutron.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/neutron/metadata.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/corosync/cs_with_service.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/corosync/cs_service.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/neutron/dhcp.pp'], 'message': 'Neutron HA composition model

Refactor all of the corosync resources to be outside of the neutron module

This allows for seperate management of the HA scripts and classes from the
neutron module and will allow the module to continue to track upstream with
out modifiation in regards to HA support

partial blueprint: merge-openstack-puppet-modules
blueprint: ml2-neutron

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: If471a371c11a26f5b4182bc3afcf391d000124aa
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron HA composition model

Refactor all of the corosync resources to be outside of the neutron module

This allows for seperate management of the HA scripts and classes from the
neutron module and will allow the module to continue to track upstream with
out modifiation in regards to HA support

partial blueprint: merge-openstack-puppet-modules
blueprint: ml2-neutron

Fuel-CI: disable

subject: Delete unused 'use_ipv6' config option
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7711, 'name': 'Yuriy Zveryanskyy', 'email': 'yzveryanskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'yuriyz'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-23 01:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conf_fixture.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/netconf.py'], 'message': 'Delete unused 'use_ipv6' config option

The 'use_ipv6' config option is not being used, and Ironic doesn't support
IPv6 (see https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1325942). Someone may
try to set this value to True, and that wouldn't do anything, so it is
better to delete it and add it back in the future when IPv6 is supported.

I'm not sure it needs a DocImpact since it never worked, but I'll tag
it, just in case we want to document that "the 'use_ipv6' config option
was deleted because it never worked".

Closes-Bug: #1384509
DocImpact

Change-Id: I7704067ca50448ffb0982e653437d151af85471f
'}]
commit_message:
Delete unused 'use_ipv6' config option

The 'use_ipv6' config option is not being used, and Ironic doesn't support
IPv6 (see https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1325942). Someone may
try to set this value to True, and that wouldn't do anything, so it is
better to delete it and add it back in the future when IPv6 is supported.

I'm not sure it needs a DocImpact since it never worked, but I'll tag
it, just in case we want to document that "the 'use_ipv6' config option
was deleted because it never worked".

Closes-Bug: #1384509
DocImpact

Change-Id: I7704067ca50448ffb0982e653437d151af85471f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-02 12:38:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_shelve.py'], 'message': 'Make test_unshelve deterministic

This change rewrites test_unshelve to no longer use a subclass of
test_compute.BaseTestCase. This means that the test no longer uses a
real database, which is a source of non-deterministic unit test
failure in the gate.

This is a complete rewrite from scratch, and should be examined
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1375688
Change-Id: I9175c8a61ce959e31aad3dacf38a436d237a093f
'}]
commit_message:
Make test_unshelve deterministic

This change rewrites test_unshelve to no longer use a subclass of
test_compute.BaseTestCase. This means that the test no longer uses a
real database, which is a source of non-deterministic unit test
failure in the gate.

This is a complete rewrite from scratch, and should be examined
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1375688
Change-Id: I9175c8a61ce959e31aad3dacf38a436d237a093f

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-10-21 14:18:34.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/storage/test_get_connection.py', 'requirements.txt', 'ceilometer/dispatcher/database.py', 'ceilometer/tests/dispatcher/test_db.py', 'ceilometer/storage/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/storage/mongo/utils.py', 'ceilometer/tests/storage/test_pymongo_base.py'], 'message': 'Allow collector service database connection retry

At the startup collector service loads the database dispatcher,

continues to run with out having the ability to re-try the DB

commit_message:
Allow collector service database connection retry

At the startup collector service loads the database dispatcher,
if the DB is offline momentarily the collector service starts but
continues to run with out having the ability to re-try the DB
connection. This fix will allow the connection to be retried next
time when collector service attempts to write to the database.

Change-Id: I10fef61a9c525e1c84d8cadbca86d6bde84927ba
Closes-Bug: 1301777

commit_message:
Revert "Replace ntp package with ntp-dev"
We don't have ntp-dev package on public mirrors yet,
so process of provisioning fails.

This reverts commit b0c585ea9a2e7eeb01fde3a26739b4404236a985.

Change-Id: Ic71c0f5404b7bed17b034089313d0ba58935b895

subject: Point all puppet projects at puppet-system.config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-22 03:40:04.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack-infra/puppet-vcsrepo.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack-infra/puppet-yum.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack-infra/puppet-vinz.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack-infra/puppet-zuul.config', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/acls/openstack-infra/puppet-dashboard.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack-infra/puppet-apparmor.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack-infra/puppet-storyboard.config'], 'message': "Point all puppet projects at puppet-system.config

The differences between these files are marginal and for most
projects they were just copying each other directly

The only anomaly of note is puppet-yum with:

requireContributorAgreement = true

But it's unclear to me whether we actually want this, so I lumped
this in with the rest of the acl merge.

Change-Id: Iae0b0e93ab66b7ecc3a9f8fa3c355b241bd39e27
"}]
commit_message:
Point all puppet projects at puppet-system.config

The differences between these files are marginal and for most
projects they were just copying each other directly

The only anomaly of note is puppet-yum with:

requireContributorAgreement = true

But it's unclear to me whether we actually want this, so I lumped
this in with the rest of the acl merge.

Change-Id: Iae0b0e93ab66b7ecc3a9f8fa3c355b241bd39e27

subject: add circular check when updating region
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-23 07:09:15.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/catalog/backends/kvs.py', 'keystone/catalog/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/exception.py', 'keystone/catalog/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': 'add circular check when updating region

Now, we can make a circle in hierarchical regions via updating region,
this can lead to endless loop when deleting region.
Add a check when updating region to ensure no circle in hierarchical
regions.

Change-Id: Id0ce214c9560c4c2c5251769136f1319082c1d8f
loses-Bug: #1383676
'}]
commit_message:
add circular check when updating region

Now, we can make a circle in hierarchical regions via updating region,
this can lead to endless loop when deleting region.
Add a check when updating region to ensure no circle in hierarchical
regions.

Change-Id: Id0ce214c9560c4c2c5251769136f1319082c1d8f
loses-Bug: #1383676

commit_message:
Purge old neutron manifests and move our customized files

outside from community neutron manifest.

This makes it easier to carry rebases forward and prevent conflicts.
This may be squased into the merge from upstream commit.

blueprint: ml2-neutron

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I9b69c2ab4cb4e476083ec9516f442d9b1911b2a7

commit_message:
Check for IPv6 file before reading

Check to see if the IPv6 disabled flag file exists
before trying to read it. This file doesn't exist
on systems with the IPv6 module blacklisted.

Closes-Bug: #1361542
Change-Id: I4064b4189cc9d8f0f0e0e7025cf6f83d5b6ec276

commit_message:
Add init methods to javascript

Currently, we have old javascripts that automatically  get initialized when
the document is ready. This patch provides a mechanism to access those
initialization code by assigning them a name.

Change-Id: I59aa4abf6c68675f7c5f2802682d73fb7beb7613
Closes-bug: #1347072

commit_message:
iso element to build bootable ISO images

This commit adds a new element named 'iso' to build a bootable
ISO image for the kernel/ramdisk emitted by the 'baremetal' or
'ramdisk' element.

Change-Id: I89d175a29e2d0bc64b47fe527f0d0f6875f6849a

commit_message:
Fix an issue with setting tempest volume vendor_name with spaces

If the volume vendor has spaces in it, for example “Open Source”, we
need to have quotes around the uses of the variables or the behavior
will not be as expected.

Change-Id: Ie1e99b6d6de2313e5b5b5a5d3057c136c9b34601

subject: An IO optimised method for accessing resource data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-27 22:14:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_nested_stack.py', 'heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'An IO optimised method for accessing resource data

This provides a wrapper over the db_api.resource_data_* methods that
attempts to avoid unnecessary database calls for get operations.

On resource create, all resource data is loaded with a single query and
stored with the resource as a dict. Calling data_set() or data_delete()
clears this dict so the next time data() is called all resource
data is loaded again from the database.

There is a future potential optimisation to prefetch the resource.data on
resource_get_by_name_and_stack, which would result in zero resource data
queries for a Stack.load.

This is part of an effort to reduce the number of database queries required
for a Stack.load operation.

Change-Id: I2564a9f953841d895acd5b853a67aa4bc375b635
Related-Bug: #1306743
'}]
commit_message:
An IO optimised method for accessing resource data

This provides a wrapper over the db_api.resource_data_* methods that
attempts to avoid unnecessary database calls for get operations.

On resource create, all resource data is loaded with a single query and
stored with the resource as a dict. Calling data_set() or data_delete()
clears this dict so the next time data() is called all resource
data is loaded again from the database.

There is a future potential optimisation to prefetch the resource.data on
resource_get_by_name_and_stack, which would result in zero resource data
queries for a Stack.load.

This is part of an effort to reduce the number of database queries required
for a Stack.load operation.

Change-Id: I2564a9f953841d895acd5b853a67aa4bc375b635
Related-Bug: #1306743

commit_message:
libvirt: use six.text_type when setting text node value in guest xml

Trying to spawn an instance with a unicode name using the libvirt driver
fails with a UnicodeDecodeError because the value is cast to str().

The fix is to use six.text_type for the cast.

Closes-Bug: #1382318

Change-Id: I4628b94459a3c1e757d388916f1268884cb02038

The versions url returns the wrong data when glance api is behind
a proxy. This adds a new config option so it can be set properly.

DocImpact

subject: Use Python 2 when installing zuul on workers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-23 00:43:07.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/prepare_node.sh'], 'message': 'Use Python 2 when installing zuul on workers

* nodepool/scripts/prepare_node.sh: The py3k-precise nodes use a
virtualenv which defaults to python3.3, and zuul has at least one
dependency which fails to install in this situation (python-daemon
tries to use a non-Py3K compliant print syntax in its
version_info.py module). By telling virtualenv to use python2
instead we sidestep this issue.

Change-Id: Idfa70dee91494da83380fa0c0a1f8427659f6ce2
'}]
commit_message:
Use Python 2 when installing zuul on workers

* nodepool/scripts/prepare_node.sh: The py3k-precise nodes use a
virtualenv which defaults to python3.3, and zuul has at least one
dependency which fails to install in this situation (python-daemon
tries to use a non-Py3K compliant print syntax in its
version_info.py module). By telling virtualenv to use python2
instead we sidestep this issue.

Change-Id: Idfa70dee91494da83380fa0c0a1f8427659f6ce2

commit_message:
VMware: remove mountpoint from VMwareVolumeOps

The VMware driver is not able to mount volumes at specified mountpoint,
so this argument is not used at all in VMwareVolumeOps. This patch
removes the 'mountpoint' argument from all attach/detach methods.

Change-Id: Ie65bb5f9202cb27b77772312ba542f6a8a3d9688

subject: Fix exit of subprocess in case it was terminated by signal
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-10-21 10:44:33.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_rootwrap.py', 'oslo/rootwrap/cmd.py'], 'message': 'Fix exit of subprocess in case it was terminated by signal

If child process of rootwrap is terminated by signal, exit code should
be 128 + N, where N is number of signal. According [1]
subprocess.Popen.returncode returns -N. sys.exit interprets negative
signed byte as unsigned thus original exit code is 256 - N instead of
128 + N.

[1]
https://docs.python.org/2/library/subprocess.html#subprocess.Popen.returncode

Change-Id: I43b4c959a98f8f620466c77de4cd5b724b09e5a8
Closes-Bug: #1364822
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exit of subprocess in case it was terminated by signal

If child process of rootwrap is terminated by signal, exit code should
be 128 + N, where N is number of signal. According [1]
subprocess.Popen.returncode returns -N. sys.exit interprets negative
signed byte as unsigned thus original exit code is 256 - N instead of
128 + N.

[1]
https://docs.python.org/2/library/subprocess.html#subprocess.Popen.returncode

Change-Id: I43b4c959a98f8f620466c77de4cd5b724b09e5a8
Closes-Bug: #1364822

commit_message:
Make sure iniset replaces commented out options

If the option passed to iniset already exists but is commented out, it will be
uncommented and its value will be changed.

Closes-Bug: #1383843

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-22 11:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['os_cloud_config/nodes.py', 'os_cloud_config/tests/test_nodes.py'], 'message': "Allow register-node to accept int for input

register-node used to pipe the nodes definition file through jq, which
explicitly converts all int values to strings, but the new
implementation doesn't do so, which is backward incompatible.

Change-Id: Id5c5b56ccd73bdabe02eb24575e5b8c4dbcdb04b
Closes-Bug: #1382275
"}]
commit_message:
Allow register-node to accept int for input

register-node used to pipe the nodes definition file through jq, which
explicitly converts all int values to strings, but the new
implementation doesn't do so, which is backward incompatible.

Change-Id: Id5c5b56ccd73bdabe02eb24575e5b8c4dbcdb04b
Closes-Bug: #1382275

commit_message:

you can hover-over to get informational text.

commit_message:
Nova api service doesn't handle SIGHUP properly

When SIGHUP signal is sent to nova-api service, it doesn't complete
processing of all pending requests before terminating all the
processes.

Closes-Bug: #1334647

Change-Id: I3f7bd0ba5ef1bb716a97635252abe251053a669d
(cherry picked from commit 224a3de466d48301ab638b60ca47d19ad6b1b1dc)

commit_message:
[Sahara] Support Nova availability zones

Add an optional field in the node group template page.  It is used for
selecting the availability zone where to spawn instances.

Change-Id: Id504ec3d0d8a398f79cc45568169e67f54a6a9b8
Implements: blueprint support-nova-availability-zones

subject: Make duration in serial test approximate total run time
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-20 14:59:43.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/run_stress.py'], 'message': 'Make duration in serial test approximate total run time

The duration argument is supposed to mean how long the test will take to
finish. Before this change, if running serially it would take n*duration where
n is the number of test cases specified to run.

Change-Id: I9bd525b17e41fae811e3bf48642b728151e65737
'}]
commit_message:
Make duration in serial test approximate total run time

The duration argument is supposed to mean how long the test will take to
finish. Before this change, if running serially it would take n*duration where
n is the number of test cases specified to run.

Change-Id: I9bd525b17e41fae811e3bf48642b728151e65737
