revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-20 20:44:33.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': "Make screen_service() useful for more than services

screen_service() can currently only be used to launch things that
pass the 'is_service_enabled' check, even though its calling functions
will have already done this.  This removes such check, renames it
to screen_process() and updates its usage elsewhere.

Change-Id: I480a4560a45b131a95c1b2d2d2379aeba542a9bc
"}]
commit_message:
Make screen_service() useful for more than services

screen_service() can currently only be used to launch things that
pass the 'is_service_enabled' check, even though its calling functions
will have already done this.  This removes such check, renames it
to screen_process() and updates its usage elsewhere.

Change-Id: I480a4560a45b131a95c1b2d2d2379aeba542a9bc

subject: Define experimental check-heat-dsvm-functional-postgres
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-21 23:21:27.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/heat.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Define experimental check-heat-dsvm-functional-postgres

This allows in-tree functional tests to be run against a postgres
devstack, but only on-demand in the experimental pipeline.

As a consequence, check-heat-dsvm-functional is renamed to
check-heat-dsvm-functional-mysql.

Change-Id: I2617f969e1832c9d78348f9c56e4b3b50f3633c7
'}]
commit_message:
Define experimental check-heat-dsvm-functional-postgres

This allows in-tree functional tests to be run against a postgres
devstack, but only on-demand in the experimental pipeline.

As a consequence, check-heat-dsvm-functional is renamed to
check-heat-dsvm-functional-mysql.

Change-Id: I2617f969e1832c9d78348f9c56e4b3b50f3633c7

We EOLed, tagged, then deleted the stable/havana branches everywhere.
Clean havana out of devstack-gate as this config is no longer necessary.

Note this adds Juno specific test-features.sh tests because the havana
tests are no longer needed but we should continue to test that we

Change-Id: Iea93ac03a9729cf6fe75a6410de4dec2c531f8d2

commit_message:
Havana branches are dead, remove havana from d-g

We EOLed, tagged, then deleted the stable/havana branches everywhere.
Clean havana out of devstack-gate as this config is no longer necessary.

Note this adds Juno specific test-features.sh tests because the havana
tests are no longer needed but we should continue to test that we
generate the proper feature lists for our stable branches.

Change-Id: Iea93ac03a9729cf6fe75a6410de4dec2c531f8d2

commit_message:
Check for VPN Objects when deleting interfaces

When we delete Router interfaces/gateway,
we need to check if any VPN services are
associated with that router.

Closes-Bug:1261598

Change-Id: I7df2b8b130b47ec070d0b0a36b1a62df40532760

subject: Stop running ceilometer mongodb jobs on icehouse
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-22 20:38:59.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Stop running ceilometer mongodb jobs on icehouse

All of our icehouse tempest jobs run on precise, but precise's mongodb
is too old for ceilometer. For this reason stop trying to run the
ceilometer mongodb tests against icehouse changes.

Change-Id: I470bbba6eec8444444eebbece7b552cee619c3a0
"}]
commit_message:
Stop running ceilometer mongodb jobs on icehouse

All of our icehouse tempest jobs run on precise, but precise's mongodb
is too old for ceilometer. For this reason stop trying to run the
ceilometer mongodb tests against icehouse changes.

Change-Id: I470bbba6eec8444444eebbece7b552cee619c3a0

Cleanup grenade machinery in prep for Juno

devstack gate. We did so in a backward compatible way for our old jobs.

commit_message:
Don't stop update immediately on error

When an error occurs during a stack update operation,
don't immediately stop the operation. Instead,
wait up to 4 minutes for resources already in progress
to complete before forcibly cancelling them.

Change-Id: Ib089dbc675c519668a44d1b0e3214feca5079978
Closes-bug: #1381984
(cherry picked from commit ddd6fc16d765e9f5aff8d8e173402caa6de6196d)

commit_message:
Neutron OVS based Distributed Virtual Router

This blueprint spec provides information
about the Neutron OVS based Distributed
Virtual Router Implementation.

This changeset addresses gaps in the original
blueprint, in order to make it current to
upstream pushed code.

This blueprint addresses both the East-West routing
and North-South routing.

commit_message:
Wait for rabbitmq to respond to commands

Sometimes rabbitmq service starts but rabbitmq
server is not ready to accept requests. This
commit adds wait loop for rabbitmq and then
allows rabbitmq_* resources to work with
rabbitmq server.

Change-Id: Ic01773a4f84bbc1fa1a4139a0a6eb366191a8b9b
Closes-bug: #1377491

commit_message:
Wait for rabbitmq to respond to commands

Sometimes rabbitmq service starts but rabbitmq
server is not ready to accept requests. This
commit adds wait loop for rabbitmq and then
allows rabbitmq_* resources to work with
rabbitmq server.

Change-Id: Ic01773a4f84bbc1fa1a4139a0a6eb366191a8b9b
Closes-bug: #1377491

subject: Clean up shell authentication
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-22 04:38:01.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/api/auth.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': "Clean up shell authentication

* Remove the auth option checks as the auth plugins will validate
  their own options
* Move the initialization of client_manager to the end of
  initialize_app() so it is always called.  Note that no attempts
  to actually authenticate occur until the first use of one of the
  client attributes in client_manager.  This leaves
  initialize_clientmanager() (formerly uathenticate_user()) empty
  so remove it.
* Remove interact() as the client_manager has already been created
  And there is nothing left.
* prepare_to_run_command() is reduced to trigger an authentication
  attempt for the best_effort auth commands, currently the only
  one is 'complete'.
* Add prompt_for_password() to ask the user to enter a password
  when necessary.  Passed to ClientManager in a new kward pw_func.

Bug: 1355838
Change-Id: I9fdec9144c4c84f65aed1cf91ce41fe1895089b2
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up shell authentication

* Remove the auth option checks as the auth plugins will validate
  their own options
* Move the initialization of client_manager to the end of
  initialize_app() so it is always called.  Note that no attempts
  to actually authenticate occur until the first use of one of the
  client attributes in client_manager.  This leaves
  initialize_clientmanager() (formerly uathenticate_user()) empty
  so remove it.
* Remove interact() as the client_manager has already been created
  And there is nothing left.
* prepare_to_run_command() is reduced to trigger an authentication
  attempt for the best_effort auth commands, currently the only
  one is 'complete'.
* Add prompt_for_password() to ask the user to enter a password
  when necessary.  Passed to ClientManager in a new kward pw_func.

Bug: 1355838
Change-Id: I9fdec9144c4c84f65aed1cf91ce41fe1895089b2

commit_message:
Make hook elements depend on heat-config

This patch updates all of the specific configuration hook elements
so that they automatically pull in the heat-config element.
This is useful in that it minimizes what a DIB user must
explicitly list on the command line when building elements.

Change-Id: Ib890e5171e9836891074925fea88169c4276d333

commit_message:
Add @_retry_on_deadlock to _instance_update()

This patch adds the @_retry_on_deadlock decorator
to _instance_update(), which has been observed to be
involved in some deadlock scenarios.  As it is the point
of transaction demarcation based on the presence of
get_session(), this is an appropriate point at which the
transaction can be re-attempted in the case of deadlock.

Change-Id: Id2cfdc129ea3cfc787b73f1f3e9aa286a7c0229a
Closes-bug: 1375467
Cherry-picked from: 68ed3c034ba1b0767694026000723e5255d24a64

Closes-Bug: #1383505
"}]
commit_message:
Tolerate null on Json db load

A icehouse->juno migration issue has surfaced where
resource.properties_data is null for existing resource records.

This change fixes the Json db type to treat None the same as
the serialized JSON 'null'.

Change-Id: Ia0b9a23a7798c95fbbcba439ffb8203b50367e7c
Closes-Bug: #1383505

commit_message:
Enable H301

Fix all failures caused by H301 (Only one import per line).
Disable H302 and H304 checks which are enabled if H301 is enabled since
they cause too many failures for now.
H302 is "import only modules" - thus this fixes a few cases of this as
well (importing mock instead of "from mock import patch").

Change-Id: I899d00099cbd276f489b984d7993ae795a6e5ef4
Partial-Bug: #1337409

commit_message:

Install Guide.

revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2014-10-22 08:57:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py'], 'message': "VMware: Use the VM location to find iSCSI targets

When attaching an iSCSI volume, Nova triggers a HBA scan in order to
find the static targets and indirectly populates the SCSI topology in
vCenter.
The current implementation takes the first host found as the host to
perform the scan. This doesn't take into account the fact that the VM
can run on another host. This is problematic because then the host
where the VM is running is not aware of the target that the VM is
supposed to be attached to.

This patch fixes the issue by using the instance to retrieve the host
where the VM is running instead of using the cluster reference.
Consequently, a NoValidHost exception is thrown if the instance
doesn't have a host to run on.

Change-Id: Id1fe8aa5f1f3ecb0b52aa6d5543741c1ef71c82c
Closes-Bug: #1325789
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Use the VM location to find iSCSI targets

When attaching an iSCSI volume, Nova triggers a HBA scan in order to
find the static targets and indirectly populates the SCSI topology in
vCenter.
The current implementation takes the first host found as the host to
perform the scan. This doesn't take into account the fact that the VM
can run on another host. This is problematic because then the host
where the VM is running is not aware of the target that the VM is
supposed to be attached to.

This patch fixes the issue by using the instance to retrieve the host
where the VM is running instead of using the cluster reference.
Consequently, a NoValidHost exception is thrown if the instance
doesn't have a host to run on.

Change-Id: Id1fe8aa5f1f3ecb0b52aa6d5543741c1ef71c82c
Closes-Bug: #1325789

commit_message:
Add hacking check for use of log level markers

Since we have decided to not use log level markers in Cinder
for the time being I am adding a hacking check to make sure
that people don't start adding them.

Change-Id: I4f26b8ba059ad0028f1c4cd699b706525b13c347

commit_message:
Remove unused _LW, _LC, _LI and _LE from i18n.py

As was recommended during the review of a related patch
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/129297) I am removing the
definition of _LW, _LC, _LI and _LE from cinder/i18n.py.  This
ensures, along with the change proposed in 129297, that users will
not be able to import/use the _L* log level markers.

Change-Id: Idadfbffd4e1425babb5e91416614638153ca6105

commit_message:
Create Nova Scheduler IO Ops Weighter

Add a new nova scheduler weighter, sort the filter
hosts according to host io ops number, aims to
booting instances on light workload hosts.

DocImpact: Adds io_ops_weight_multiplier to [DEFAULT]
group of nova.conf and an new default schedule weigher.
Change-Id: Ib3c9184f10b2ebe6b1230365a51b5542dffd447c
Implements: blueprint io-ops-weight

commit_message:
Set Tempest storage protocol and vendor w/o setting driver

Set TEMPEST_STORAGE_PROTOCOL and TEMPEST_VOLUME_VENDOR if
they are changed from their defaults, or if
TEMPEST_VOLUME_DRIVER is changed.

This maintains the current behavior of setting these options if
TEMPEST_VOLUME_DRIVER is set to something other than "default".

Change-Id: I1fb7f5db0446f97de48b97a6f451882cc51c51a4

commit_message:
Enforce requirements check only for registered projects

Per documentation and discussion on mailing list, we should fail
requirements check only if the project is listed in projects.txt.
Any projects not in projects.txt are free to use libraries not
listed in global requirements file.

Change-Id: Ie1aad34585a8728ace4f7ba1cf365210449e8e1c

commit_message:
Replace admin@example.org with admin@localhost

Fuel configures account under Admin/Identity Panel/Users
with email address of admin@example.org.  To prevent
sending unwarranted messages to admin.org domain,
replacing that with admin@localhost.

Change-Id: I2cc13f64ce16ceb8913b328c9183ab91722c4c48
Closes-Bug: 1372336

commit_message:
Fix 'resume' behaivour

On KVM environments, domain property 'state' is a function that
returns a list like this: domain.state() = [3, 1]

This patch needs to be tested on VBOX environment before merging.

Change-Id: I610f6ef042d0e246b875d83188e382781995e737
Closes-Bug: #1383642

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-10-21 13:38:15.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/drac/test_power.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/tests/db/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_ports.py', 'ironic/tests/db/test_ports.py', 'ironic/tests/objects/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/db/test_chassis.py', 'ironic/tests/db/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/ilo/test_power.py', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_nodes.py'], 'message': 'Removed hardcoded IDs from "node" test resources

Test resources are generated using certain helper methods to provide
key/value data. These methods hardcode ID fields which map to primary
key in the database. Subsequent creates on these resources force the
database to assign hardcoded primary keys, ignoring DB's internal
mechanisms. Though unlikely, this could lead to primary key conflicts.

This commit removes hardcoded IDs from node resources.

Change-Id: I29db29516a0a5bb00fa656c96c72636767d24bc6
Partial-Bug: #1268589
'}]
commit_message:
Removed hardcoded IDs from "node" test resources

Test resources are generated using certain helper methods to provide
key/value data. These methods hardcode ID fields which map to primary
key in the database. Subsequent creates on these resources force the
database to assign hardcoded primary keys, ignoring DB's internal
mechanisms. Though unlikely, this could lead to primary key conflicts.

This commit removes hardcoded IDs from node resources.

Change-Id: I29db29516a0a5bb00fa656c96c72636767d24bc6
Partial-Bug: #1268589

commit_message:
Hide the "Host Aggregates" admin panel if not enabled

access to the panel (hiding it) if not.

subject: Remove hardcoded IDs - possible alternative (DO NOT MERGE)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-16 21:52:05.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/db/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/objects/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/db/test_nodes.py'], 'message': "Remove hardcoded IDs - possible alternative (DO NOT MERGE)

Dmitry, I made these changes on top of your patch. It seemed like the
easiest way to show you an alternative that makes more sense to me.

Adding the 'ignored_fields' parameter generalizes things and adds more
flexibility, except that I honestly don't see why we'd need that flexibility.

It seems to me that the problem stems from test.db.utils.get_test_node()
being used for two different purposes:
1. to reflect a node that was added to the DB. In this case, it needs an id
2. to contain node information to be used to create a node. When creating
   a node (ie adding to the DB), the idea is to let the DB assign the
   id value, unless the id value is explicitly passed when calling
   test.db.utils.create_test_node().

So this change basically leaves .get_test_node() alone, but where it is
used to get info for creating a node, the hard-coded id is not used (and
hence deleted).

Change-Id: I6ed15b51cc247c599addbe7098d08f8ba5f4d66b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove hardcoded IDs - possible alternative (DO NOT MERGE)

Dmitry, I made these changes on top of your patch. It seemed like the
easiest way to show you an alternative that makes more sense to me.

Adding the 'ignored_fields' parameter generalizes things and adds more
flexibility, except that I honestly don't see why we'd need that flexibility.

It seems to me that the problem stems from test.db.utils.get_test_node()
being used for two different purposes:
1. to reflect a node that was added to the DB. In this case, it needs an id
2. to contain node information to be used to create a node. When creating
   a node (ie adding to the DB), the idea is to let the DB assign the
   id value, unless the id value is explicitly passed when calling
   test.db.utils.create_test_node().

So this change basically leaves .get_test_node() alone, but where it is
used to get info for creating a node, the hard-coded id is not used (and
hence deleted).

Change-Id: I6ed15b51cc247c599addbe7098d08f8ba5f4d66b

subject: Restart DHCP only when needed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-16 19:13:53.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/restart-dhcp-only-when-needed.rst'], 'message': 'Restart DHCP only when needed

Instead of an unhandled exception causing the restart of every dnsmasq
process on a system, instead restart only processes that are tied to the
network that had an operation that threw an exception.

Change-Id: Ide80cea5126ad0d8f4e47a011582198801f15fae
'}]
commit_message:
Restart DHCP only when needed

Instead of an unhandled exception causing the restart of every dnsmasq
process on a system, instead restart only processes that are tied to the
network that had an operation that threw an exception.

Change-Id: Ide80cea5126ad0d8f4e47a011582198801f15fae
